profile.name: Naomi Ruth Attaway

title: Keeps the brain sharp!!
body: This is a great workbook to review concepts learned during the school year. I purchased this book for my child to use during the summer to keep his mind sharp. He does a couple of pages each day, and is done! The books are wonderful for helping students retain information that is often lost during summer break. My son likes that he isn't sitting for long periods of time doing work, so it still feels like summer break vs school! Once in a while I'll catch him doing more pages, or doing some another time of the day.  I have purchased other workbooks from stores, and the kids have no interest in them. The Summer Bridge books hold their attention, which is something I find positive. I also like that the book mixes concepts, so my child isn't only doing math, writing, etc. They change it up a bit, which plays a big part in holding interest. The book also comes with flash cards, stickers, and a certificate when they complete the pages. I would not use the books as a sole teaching tool, but it is great for supplementing during the school year, or for school breaks (like we are doing).I would definitely buy these again, as my children progress.

title: Great for staying on grade level over the summer
body: I have bought summer bridging workbooks for several years for all of my daughters to use. They are a great tool to keep your child on grade level over the summer. The books are designed so that there is not too much work to do each day. Perhaps only 15 to 20 minutes worth of work. The books are also organized so that there is a variety of information being covered each day so it is not all one subject. The books are also designed to meet state guidelines so the information covered is what your child has seen in class throughout the year. I would highly recommend these bridging workbooks.

body: This brand is incredible. We've used it as practice over the summer for several years now. Some of it does not match the curriculum we have locally but it gives us a chance to go over a variety of new material with the kids. We initially were looking something after a difficult year in 2nd grade. Not only did my kid catch up, his grades improved dramatically in 3rd grade and he moved to honors classes by 4th. I genuinely feel it's the extra effort he's put in by using these, and the time we get to spend together going over the material. I feel a lot more involved and able to understand what he's doing (given that one year he had no homework and it was difficult to tell what they were learning week to week).

profile.name: Simbi Madzudzo

title: A manageable addition to your summer routine to keep skills fresh.
body: I've gotten these books for my son every summer for the last 3 or 4 years. He hates them! But that's not a reflection on the product, but rather my parenting style. :-) These books provide simple, one-sheet-a-day activities to keep kids' skills fresh over the long summer. In theory, the activities should not take more than 30 minutes a day (probably less), but with the fighting that goes on in our house, the daily routine can last upwards of 2 hours. (Again, a reflection not on the product so much, but our family.) I have found, at times, that the skills do not entirely line up with our state curriculum, so I do have to teach him skills from time to time. These activities are not a massive time-hog for lazy summer days, but provide enough reinforcement to make the back-to-school transition relatively painless.

profile.name: Joe Lewis

title: I get these every year!
body: I'm not one to follow every little trend when it comes to children and education (I'm an old-fashioned, books-and-pencils kind of mother), but I absolutely do believe that summer learning loss is a real thing. I have my children do these bridge books every summer (along with the pleasure reading of their choice), and it makes a huge difference. They do 2 pages a day (I'm relaxed on weekends and during trips), so they still get plenty of play time--but they go back to school with at least a vague memory of what they've just learned, and I think they're also slightly ahead of the game with new material. Both of my children have made straight A's this year. I highly recommend these books!

profile.name: Danielle

title: Loved it
body: Pretty sure I’m still on the verge of tears while writing this, and that’s because of how emotionally invested I was in the relationship. Jimenez is so skilled at writing these playful, chemistry-filled romances that make me smile one minute and have a churning in my gut the next. This one really put me through my paces emotionally, with these gorgeous, sunshiney moments juxtaposed with an undercurrent of heartache and pain. These two fell for each other in such an effortless way, even though that was never the plan. Our sweetheart of a hero was swooning from the start, and I LOVED how adorably smitten he was. So freaking adorable, this man. Our black cat heroine put up a good fight, but she didn’t stand a chance against him. The relationship was bright and easy, which contrasted perfectly with the chaos swirling around them both. Neither was in the right headspace to fall in love, but it found them anyways - even though the road to HEA was filled with landmines. Such a compelling and complex read, EASILY my new favorite from the author.  The story follows Emma, a woman who is constantly on the move. She didn’t have the best childhood, so she prefers to take temporary jobs and travel around the country with her best friend. One day, Emma reads an AITA post and relates to the guy - every time he dates someone, the next person they meet ends up being their soulmate. The same thing seems to happen to Emma every time, so the two bond over DMs and text messages. It’s not long before Emma and Justin make a plan - they’ll go on a few dates with each other and break both of their dating curses. But once they meet face-to-face, that plan begins to crumble. Not only do they get along way better than either could’ve anticipated, but keeping things fun and easy is impossible to do when both of their messy families get involved. Soon, Justin and Emma are falling for each other in a very real way, which could cause trouble for them both.  I loved the concept of two strangers who bond over DMs and messages before connecting in person, and the epistolary element was great. Justin and Emma both know they’re not in the right headspace for something real, but that’s not what they ever intended to be for each other. Their relationship developed so naturally, and it was easy to see how perfect they were for each other. I was laughing, smiling, and swooning right along with them, especially since Justin is such a fantastic man. He’s so steady and cuddly and adorable, even though he’s barely keeping his head above water. It’s definitely a case of meeting the right person at the absolute worst time, which ratchets up the tension in a major way. Emma is such a complicated character, but I loved her too. After six books, I’m never surprised when Jimenez emotionally devastates me with her twists and turns, but I was still taken aback by how much it hurt this time. It’s not a story I’ll be forgetting anytime soon, it’s both entertaining and impactful. I loved it!  Audio note: The audio is fabulous, highly recommended in the format! The epistolary element at the beginning is almost duet-style, so I had my fingers crossed that it would be that way throughout (it’s not), but both narrators give excellent, emotive performances. I’m not familiar with Christine Laken, but I loved her voice and the emotion she was able to infuse into the story. There were a couple of instances where it was difficult to tell who she was voicing, but that would be my only complaint. This is the best I’ve ever heard Zachary Webber, he gives an incredibly strong performance. The runtime (11-12 hours) was just slightly more than I could get through in a single day, but I could not wait to dive back in. There’s a very minimal amount of spice, so no worries there if you plan to listen at work - just be aware that you might start crying at any time, lol. All in all, I’m very glad I was able to experience the story in that format.
body_html:
Pretty sure I’m still on the verge of tears while writing this, and that’s because of how emotionally invested I was in the relationship. Jimenez is so skilled at writing these playful, chemistry-filled romances that make me smile one minute and have a churning in my gut the next. This one really put me through my paces emotionally, with these gorgeous, sunshiney moments juxtaposed with an undercurrent of heartache and pain. These two fell for each other in such an effortless way, even though that was never the plan. Our sweetheart of a hero was swooning from the start, and I LOVED how adorably smitten he was. So freaking adorable, this man. Our black cat heroine put up a good fight, but she didn’t stand a chance against him. The relationship was bright and easy, which contrasted perfectly with the chaos swirling around them both. Neither was in the right headspace to fall in love, but it found them anyways - even though the road to HEA was filled with landmines. Such a compelling and complex read, EASILY my new favorite from the author.

The story follows Emma, a woman who is constantly on the move. She didn’t have the best childhood, so she prefers to take temporary jobs and travel around the country with her best friend. One day, Emma reads an AITA post and relates to the guy - every time he dates someone, the next person they meet ends up being their soulmate. The same thing seems to happen to Emma every time, so the two bond over DMs and text messages. It’s not long before Emma and Justin make a plan - they’ll go on a few dates with each other and break both of their dating curses. But once they meet face-to-face, that plan begins to crumble. Not only do they get along way better than either could’ve anticipated, but keeping things fun and easy is impossible to do when both of their messy families get involved. Soon, Justin and Emma are falling for each other in a very real way, which could cause trouble for them both.

I loved the concept of two strangers who bond over DMs and messages before connecting in person, and the epistolary element was great. Justin and Emma both know they’re not in the right headspace for something real, but that’s not what they ever intended to be for each other. Their relationship developed so naturally, and it was easy to see how perfect they were for each other. I was laughing, smiling, and swooning right along with them, especially since Justin is such a fantastic man. He’s so steady and cuddly and adorable, even though he’s barely keeping his head above water. It’s definitely a case of meeting the right person at the absolute worst time, which ratchets up the tension in a major way. Emma is such a complicated character, but I loved her too. After six books, I’m never surprised when Jimenez emotionally devastates me with her twists and turns, but I was still taken aback by how much it hurt this time. It’s not a story I’ll be forgetting anytime soon, it’s both entertaining and impactful. I loved it!

Audio note: The audio is fabulous, highly recommended in the format! The epistolary element at the beginning is almost duet-style, so I had my fingers crossed that it would be that way throughout (it’s not), but both narrators give excellent, emotive performances. I’m not familiar with Christine Laken, but I loved her voice and the emotion she was able to infuse into the story. There were a couple of instances where it was difficult to tell who she was voicing, but that would be my only complaint. This is the best I’ve ever heard Zachary Webber, he gives an incredibly strong performance. The runtime (11-12 hours) was just slightly more than I could get through in a single day, but I could not wait to dive back in. There’s a very minimal amount of spice, so no worries there if you plan to listen at work - just be aware that you might start crying at any time, lol. All in all, I’m very glad I was able to experience the story in that format.

title: Somehow comical and touching! Great Read!
body: At the time of writing this, I can say this is hands down my favorite 2024 book thus far. This hook was both comical and touching. Silly and deep. Tragic and uplifting. All of the characters were incredibly well developed. I instantly felt for both Justin and Emma. I loved the varying family dynamics including chosen family elements too! I thought this book beautifully tackled every day struggles with mental health. Several times the book actually moved me to tears. Justin is basically the perfect man and Emma was so beautifully raw. What a fantastic story. Highly highly recommend!

profile.name: C

title: "Always choose empathy"
body: "The best kind of love doesn't happen on moonlit walks and romantic vacations. It happens in between the folds of everyday life.”  Another fabulous, unique, slowburn RomCom from Abby Jimenez set at a summer cottage on the lake, full of insightful depth and emotions and just the right amount of spice!  I’m a huge fan of Abby’s writing style and how well she develops her characters in all her books. This book was no different. Emma, the FMC, has a fear of long term commitment due to childhood trauma. Her character wasn’t easy to connect with at the beginning but I feel like it was written this way to show how hard it was for her to connect and trust people. As the story unfolds it is easier to understand why the traveling nurse is slow to trust and has a fear of long term commitments. I loved Emma’s best friend Maddy and her no nonsense, overprotective but hilarious personality. Then there’s Justin…a perfect selfless gentleman/boyfriend who isn’t afraid of a commitment, no matter the cost. He is resilient and always puts everyone else’s needs before his own.  I appreciate that Abby isn’t afraid to include the topic of mental health and trauma in her books. The layers of emotion and trauma are raw, but realistic, and are presented in an accurate but sensitive way. She shows the effects that trauma has on relationships are real and not something to take lightly. There are some heavy topics and complex family dynamics but there’s also found family, which is always uplifting and heartwarming.  This is the third book in the Part of Your World series. I suggest reading them in order so you can catch all the Easter eggs hidden within this book but you could definitely read it as a standalone as well. Don’t skip over the Q&A with the author at the end of the book, it is very insightful.
body_html:
"The best kind of love doesn't happen on moonlit walks and romantic vacations. It happens in between the folds of everyday life.”

profile.name: Plans2Read

title: Captivating Characters and Seamless Storytelling: A Review of 'Just for the Summer' by Abby Jimenez
body: "Just for the Summer" by Abby Jimenez captivated me from start to finish, earning its place as one of the best stories I've ever read. Emma and Justin's characters were so compelling, which is rare for me as I don't easily connect with heroines in books. Their struggles were portrayed with such depth that it added a wonderful layer of conflict to the narrative.  I particularly enjoyed the incorporation of the Reddit post, which added a hilarious and authentic touch. The recurring question of "Am I the A-hole?" provided a delightful comic element throughout the story. Jimenez's storytelling prowess truly shines here, seamlessly blending humor with moments that evoked genuine tears from me.  What struck me most was the seamless connection to the first book, "Part of Your World." It prompted me to revisit the earlier story, realizing how much I had forgotten. Upon rereading both books, I found myself even more enamored with "Just for the Summer."  Our international book club had a riveting discussion about the characters, particularly Amber, whose complexity led us to ponder whether she was a narcissist, bipolar, or a blend of both. The depth and believability of the characters sparked conversations as if they were real individuals rather than fictional creations.  Experiencing the book through both Kindle and Audible, narrated by Christine Lakin and Zachary Weber, was a treat. Both narrators brought the story to life with their exceptional talent, enhancing the overall experience.  I wholeheartedly recommend any book penned by Abby Jimenez. Her storytelling prowess and ability to craft multidimensional characters make her a must-read author for me.
body_html:
"Just for the Summer" by Abby Jimenez captivated me from start to finish, earning its place as one of the best stories I've ever read. Emma and Justin's characters were so compelling, which is rare for me as I don't easily connect with heroines in books. Their struggles were portrayed with such depth that it added a wonderful layer of conflict to the narrative.

I particularly enjoyed the incorporation of the Reddit post, which added a hilarious and authentic touch. The recurring question of "Am I the A-hole?" provided a delightful comic element throughout the story. Jimenez's storytelling prowess truly shines here, seamlessly blending humor with moments that evoked genuine tears from me.

What struck me most was the seamless connection to the first book, "Part of Your World." It prompted me to revisit the earlier story, realizing how much I had forgotten. Upon rereading both books, I found myself even more enamored with "Just for the Summer."

Our international book club had a riveting discussion about the characters, particularly Amber, whose complexity led us to ponder whether she was a narcissist, bipolar, or a blend of both. The depth and believability of the characters sparked conversations as if they were real individuals rather than fictional creations.

Experiencing the book through both Kindle and Audible, narrated by Christine Lakin and Zachary Weber, was a treat. Both narrators brought the story to life with their exceptional talent, enhancing the overall experience.

I wholeheartedly recommend any book penned by Abby Jimenez. Her storytelling prowess and ability to craft multidimensional characters make her a must-read author for me.

profile.name: Laura M. Ferguson

title: I wanted it to be a 5
body: When I started reading this book, I was instantly hooked. I love when a MMC falls first. Their story was perfect and I loved the dynamic with Maddy too. The humor was spot on! My issue lies with the last 25% of the story. It was meant to show the hardships in life and the difficulty of overcoming it. I found it very meh…. The separation wasn’t necessary and the mom took up too much of the plot. I would have loved to read more about their life and little family.
body_html:

profile.name: Abby

title: A Wonderful, Heartfelt Love Story
body: Emma and Justin are cursed. Every time each of them dates someone else that person finds their soulmate immediately after. After Justin writes a thread on Reddit, the two of them find each other and decide to date each other in hopes they will both find their own soulmates. What they don't expect is to be drawn to each other more than they ever thought possible. After meeting, they both go through their own family hardships, and luckily they are both there to help each other out in ways they never imagined.  I LOVED this book and could not put down. I fell in love with both of the characters, especially Justin who is just too good to be true (my favorite in a book). I laughed and I cried. It was a wonderful, heartfelt story that has a sweet love story, but also hardships for people with mental health problems. I thought it was very well-written and I was never bored. I did find out that it goes with two other books and I think I would have liked to read them first but did not seem to miss them while reading this story. If you love a good story about two characters who have a rough life but find each other, then this is the book for you! I highly recommend!

profile.name: Rebekah Chaney

title: Abby’s best
body: another abby book, another forever favorite.  this book hit so hard for me. emma is a traveling nurse hopping from place to place and never setting down. justin is about to become a single guardian to his three younger siblings and needs stability. when a reddit AITA post brings them together, they realize that they both have a curse: every person they date and breakup with finds their The One immediately after them. their solution? four dates, a kiss, and a breakup. just for the summer.  abby’s writing and her character building is honestly exquisite. every character she brings to life is full of life and nuance, and emma and justin are some of the best characters that are going to stay with me for a very long time. because of emma’s upbringing, she’s closed off and aloof. justin just needs her to meet him where he is. and their story is one of building trust and friendship while fighting the insane connection the two of them share.  this book had me in giggles one minute and tears the next. it is heavy, emotional, and full of so much heart. abby’s mental health rep is always so spot on, and she blew me out of the water with this one. emma is a deeply flawed fmc, and her journey was so powerful. and justin was literally perfect. these characters are so nuanced and written with such intentionality I didn’t have a choice to fall in love with them.
body_html:

abby’s writing and her character building is honestly exquisite. every character she brings to life is full of life and nuance, and emma and justin are some of the best characters that are going to stay with me for a very long time. because of emma’s upbringing, she’s closed off and aloof. justin just needs her to meet him where he is. and their story is one of building trust and friendship while fighting the insane connection the two of them share.

this book had me in giggles one minute and tears the next. it is heavy, emotional, and full of so much heart. abby’s mental health rep is always so spot on, and she blew me out of the water with this one. emma is a deeply flawed fmc, and her journey was so powerful. and justin was literally perfect. these characters are so nuanced and written with such intentionality I didn’t have a choice to fall in love with them.

profile.name: Monica

title: Beautifully written
body: "You're not asking for too much. You were just asking the wrong person. Ask me instead."  This book was another win for me by Abby! It was beautiful! This book is about healing from the trauma that is placed on you by others. And is it worth letting those people stay in your life if you're constanting having to put yourself back together after the damage they cause over and over again! So much of this book I could relate to! Which hit so hard! I'm always so grateful for writers like Abby, who put words to emotions I've never been able to!  ☀️  Justin and Emma struggle with the same curse. Whoever they date, the next person they date falls in love with their soul mate!  Emma was used to running. Never putting down roots so she never had to lose anything. So when Justin offers a deal to break their curse together, she agrees, knowing it'll only be temporary. Because temporary she could do. Temporary was her normal!  But Emma wasn't expecting to find a safe place in Justin. And that was scarier than she could have ever imagined. But slowly, Justin shows her what it was like to have someone who is constant and what it feels like to be wanted.  ☀️  A few of my favorite parts: (I tried very hard not to include spoilers but read with caution or dont)  -Justin was such an overthinker, and I loved it!-  “I’m thinking that I like you a lot more than I thought I would. I’m thinking that I probably smell because it’s hot and all my deodorant washed off in the pool, and that this place would be the perfect place to kiss you like I’m supposed to, but I wouldn’t because of the deodorant thing. I’m thinking that this whole thing with your mom and Neil feels weird, and I can’t put my finger on why. I’m thinking that I don’t like her because she’s ignoring you for some guy she just met, and I feel bad that I don’t like her because I know you do. And then I’m wondering if I’m too hard on people, because I can’t stop thinking about what you said earlier, that you should always choose empathy, and if you can choose empathy with someone like that, I should be able to do it with people I love—but I can’t. I’m thinking your bathing suit looks too tight, and it looks uncomfortable like it’s going to leave lines on your skin. I’m thinking about what those lines would look like when you take it off—not in a sexual way, but also sort of in a sexual way.” I felt my face starting to heat up a little. “Aaaaand now I’m wondering if I’ve said too much and what you’re thinking.”  -His surveys were one of my favorite parts of the book. It was perfectly nerdy, and I loved it!‐  "1. On a scale from Awkward to Charming, how would you rate Justin’s performance?"  -Everyone needs a friend like Maddy! She loved Emma so fiercely. And always knew exactly how to handle her when she fell apart. Even if she didn't agree with the way Emma handled a situation, she was always there to pick her up in the end.-  "Has Maddy ever killed anyone?" She pretended to think about it. "Nobody I can prove." I was cracking up at her threatening him.  “I want you to know that your empathy is beautiful, Emma. I hope you never lose that. I do hope that one day you get some boundaries though.”  -Emma's relationship with her mom was heartbreaking!-  "So I became an island-and the island is small. I don't need anyone. And I know that sounds sort of terrible, but it's actualy comforting to know that I have this ability to need no one. It feels like a superpower. Like I'm untouchable."  -I loved Justin's mothers relationship with her best friend, Leigh. Abby always does such an incredible job with her side characters. Not only do you connect with her main characters. But her aide characters are always wonderful!‐  “Emma, you want to hold one?” Mom asked. She gasped. “Yes!” A hand emerged from the back seat with a tiny chittering raccoon in it wrapped in a bar towel. “This is George Cooney.” Emma took it and held it to her chest and looked at me with hearts in her eyes. “Look at his little hands!”  -There are just so many beautiful parts of this book! But one of my favorite qoutes were....  “Unhealed trauma is a crack. And all the little hard things that trickle into it that would have rolled off someone else, settle. Then when life gets cold, that crack gets bigger, longer, deeper. It makes new breaks. You don’t know how broken she was or what she was trying to do to fill those cracks. Being broken is not an excuse for bad behavior, you still have to make good choices and do the right thing. But it can be the reason. And sometimes understanding the reason can be what helps you heal.”  "The best kind of love doesn’t happen on moonlit walks and romantic vacations. It happens in between the folds of everyday life. It’s not grand gestures that show how you feel, it’s all the little secret things you do to make her life better that you never tell her about."  -I usually am dreading Abby's 3rd act breakups! But this time I loved it. The growth that came from it was so needed and the book wouldn't have been the same without it. Was it heartbreaking to read? 1000% But this time it was as beautiful as it was heartbreaking!-  -AND I CANT FORGET THE EASTER EGGS!! I have to admit I didn't see any of those twists coming. But to see that come full circle was pretty cool!  I also listened to the audio after reading the book and it was an incredible performance by Chrstine Lakin and Zachary Webber!! They were the perfect voices for these two characters!
body_html:
"You're not asking for too much. You were just asking the wrong person. Ask me instead."

This book was another win for me by Abby! It was beautiful!
This book is about healing from the trauma that is placed on you by others. And is it worth letting those people stay in your life if you're constanting having to put yourself back together after the damage they cause over and over again!
So much of this book I could relate to! Which hit so hard! I'm always so grateful for writers like Abby, who put words to emotions I've never been able to!

☀️

Justin and Emma struggle with the same curse. Whoever they date, the next person they date falls in love with their soul mate!

Emma was used to running. Never putting down roots so she never had to lose anything. So when Justin offers a deal to break their curse together, she agrees, knowing it'll only be temporary. Because temporary she could do. Temporary was her normal!

But Emma wasn't expecting to find a safe place in Justin. And that was scarier than she could have ever imagined. But slowly, Justin shows her what it was like to have someone who is constant and what it feels like to be wanted.

☀️

A few of my favorite parts:
(I tried very hard not to include spoilers but read with caution or dont)

-Justin was such an overthinker, and I loved it!-

“I’m thinking that I like you a lot more than I thought I would. I’m thinking that I probably smell because it’s hot and all my deodorant washed off in the pool, and that this place would be the perfect place to kiss you like I’m supposed to, but I wouldn’t because of the deodorant thing. I’m thinking that this whole thing with your mom and Neil feels weird, and I can’t put my finger on why. I’m thinking that I don’t like her because she’s ignoring you for some guy she just met, and I feel bad that I don’t like her because I know you do. And then I’m wondering if I’m too hard on people, because I can’t stop thinking about what you said earlier, that you should always choose empathy, and if you can choose empathy with someone like that, I should be able to do it with people I love—but I can’t. I’m thinking your bathing suit looks too tight, and it looks uncomfortable like it’s going to leave lines on your skin. I’m thinking about what those lines would look like when you take it off—not in a sexual way, but also sort of in a sexual way.” I felt my face starting to heat up a little. “Aaaaand now I’m wondering if I’ve said too much and what you’re thinking.”

-His surveys were one of my favorite parts of the book. It was perfectly nerdy, and I loved it!‐

"1. On a scale from Awkward to Charming, how would you rate Justin’s performance?"

-Everyone needs a friend like Maddy! She loved Emma so fiercely. And always knew exactly how to handle her when she fell apart. Even if she didn't agree with the way Emma handled a situation, she was always there to pick her up in the end.-

"Has Maddy ever killed anyone?"
She pretended to think about it. "Nobody I can prove." I was cracking up at her threatening him.

“I want you to know that your empathy is beautiful, Emma. I hope you never lose that. I do hope that one day you get some boundaries though.”

-Emma's relationship with her mom was heartbreaking!-

"So I became an island-and the island is small. I don't need anyone. And I know that sounds sort of terrible, but it's actualy comforting to know that I have this ability to need no one. It feels
like a superpower. Like I'm untouchable."

-I loved Justin's mothers relationship with her best friend, Leigh. Abby always does such an incredible job with her side characters. Not only do you connect with her main characters. But her aide characters are always wonderful!‐

“Emma, you want to hold one?” Mom asked.
She gasped. “Yes!”
A hand emerged from the back seat with a tiny chittering raccoon in it wrapped in a bar towel.
“This is George Cooney.”
Emma took it and held it to her chest and looked at me with hearts in her eyes. “Look at his little hands!”

-There are just so many beautiful parts of this book! But one of my favorite qoutes were....

“Unhealed trauma is a crack. And all the little hard things that trickle into it that would have rolled off someone else, settle. Then when life gets cold, that crack gets bigger, longer, deeper. It makes new breaks. You don’t know how broken she was or what she was trying to do to fill those cracks. Being broken is not an excuse for bad behavior, you still have to make good choices and do the right thing. But it can be the reason. And sometimes understanding the reason can be what helps you heal.”

"The best kind of love doesn’t happen on moonlit walks and romantic vacations. It happens in between the folds of everyday life. It’s not grand gestures that show how you feel, it’s all the little secret things you do to make her life better that you never tell her about."

-I usually am dreading Abby's 3rd act breakups! But this time I loved it. The growth that came from it was so needed and the book wouldn't have been the same without it.
Was it heartbreaking to read? 1000%
But this time it was as beautiful as it was heartbreaking!-

-AND I CANT FORGET THE EASTER EGGS!! I have to admit I didn't see any of those twists coming. But to see that come full circle was pretty cool!

I also listened to the audio after reading the book and it was an incredible performance by Chrstine Lakin and Zachary Webber!! They were the perfect voices for these two characters!
date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on April 6, 2024
profile.name: Shana

title: An easy 5 star read and will be one of my top favorite reads of 2024!
body: Absolutely loved loved loved! I devoured this book, and although I kept trying to pace myself so it would last longer, I ended up finishing it in less than 24 hours, because I just couldn't put it down! An easy 5 star read for me and I have no doubt it'll be one of my top favorite books of 2024!  I was excited about this book's release thinking that I would like it, but I was not expecting to love it as much as I did! My favorite Abby Jimenez book by far! It was absolute perfection. I mean we have a gardening loving, travel nurse as our female main character then we throw in a dash of magical realism?! Are you kidding me? If that book isn't meant for me than I don't know what is! 😂  One of my major conditions on how much I love a rom-com is how it makes me feel while reading it. If the book is giving me butterflies, heart-dropping angst, and making me kick my legs because I am so giddy, then it's 5 star perfection and this, my friends, gave me all of this and more.  The characters were absolutely perfect. As I mentioned earlier, Emma was a FMC of my dreams, but then we get the MMC, Justin, who was just as perfect. From page one, I was hooked and was pleasantly surprised to see what this storyline was all about. Both characters believe their love lives to be cursed. After dating someone and breaking up with them that person always meets the love of their life right after. Discovering one another through a Reddit thread and both sharing the same dilemma, Emma and Justin decide to date for a short period of time to cancel out each other's curse. And well, we all know where this is going. 😉  Another thing I loved and what I really appreciated the author gave us is a believable third act conflict. We all know when picking up a romance, we are getting one. Unfortunately, sometimes they can really mess the flow up for me while reading, because at times they don't feel natural, or they are just plain silly like the dreaded miscommunication trope, which is guaranteed to make my eyes roll. I was so pleasantly surprised we didn't get one of those and instead got a great segue into how the book concludes. 🙌  This is a standalone novel in case anyone was wondering. Abby gives us lots of Easter eggs and it was fun to read her thought process at the end of why she included what. But luckily you don't have to read any of her previous books to enjoy this one and in my opinion, they weren't too spoiler-y.  Overall, and I can't stress this enough I loved it and can't recommend it enough. I feel it would be a slam dunk winner for anyone who decides to pick it up!
body_html:
Absolutely loved loved loved! I devoured this book, and although I kept trying to pace myself so it would last longer, I ended up finishing it in less than 24 hours, because I just couldn't put it down! An easy 5 star read for me and I have no doubt it'll be one of my top favorite books of 2024!

I was excited about this book's release thinking that I would like it, but I was not expecting to love it as much as I did! My favorite Abby Jimenez book by far! It was absolute perfection. I mean we have a gardening loving, travel nurse as our female main character then we throw in a dash of magical realism?! Are you kidding me? If that book isn't meant for me than I don't know what is! 😂

One of my major conditions on how much I love a rom-com is how it makes me feel while reading it. If the book is giving me butterflies, heart-dropping angst, and making me kick my legs because I am so giddy, then it's 5 star perfection and this, my friends, gave me all of this and more.

The characters were absolutely perfect. As I mentioned earlier, Emma was a FMC of my dreams, but then we get the MMC, Justin, who was just as perfect. From page one, I was hooked and was pleasantly surprised to see what this storyline was all about. Both characters believe their love lives to be cursed. After dating someone and breaking up with them that person always meets the love of their life right after. Discovering one another through a Reddit thread and both sharing the same dilemma, Emma and Justin decide to date for a short period of time to cancel out each other's curse. And well, we all know where this is going. 😉

Another thing I loved and what I really appreciated the author gave us is a believable third act conflict. We all know when picking up a romance, we are getting one. Unfortunately, sometimes they can really mess the flow up for me while reading, because at times they don't feel natural, or they are just plain silly like the dreaded miscommunication trope, which is guaranteed to make my eyes roll. I was so pleasantly surprised we didn't get one of those and instead got a great segue into how the book concludes. 🙌

This is a standalone novel in case anyone was wondering. Abby gives us lots of Easter eggs and it was fun to read her thought process at the end of why she included what. But luckily you don't have to read any of her previous books to enjoy this one and in my opinion, they weren't too spoiler-y.

Overall, and I can't stress this enough I loved it and can't recommend it enough. I feel it would be a slam dunk winner for anyone who decides to pick it up!

profile.name: Celene

title: Rating: 4.25 Stars
body: “The best kind of love doesn't happen on moonlit walks and romantic vacations. It happens in between the folds of everyday life.”  “In a world where you can choose anger or empathy, always choose empathy.”  Read if you Enjoy: * Lake Vibes * He Falls First * Forced Proximity * Online meet-cute * Found family * Dual POV * Mental Health Awareness/ Trauma  Rating:  “You’re not asking too much,” he said. “You were just asking the wrong person. Ask me instead.”  Abby has done it again! This book was everything I expected and more.  First of all, even though this book can be read as a standalone, I would highly recommend reading Part of Your World and Yours Truly first to understand some of the events/characters that take place in this one. Specifically Part of Your World as the big shocker in the end is connected.  Now on to this review! Justin and Emma meet online through a Reddit post as both characters connect over their unfortunate bad luck in love. You see… every time they date someone and they break up, the exes move on to find the love of their lives. Through a mutual pact, they both agree to date each other and “break” their curse. The rules… four dates, one kiss, and a breakup. Not complicated at all, right?  I loved this book! The amount of meaningful quotes and laugh-out-loud moments had me eating the pages. Justin has become a favorite MMC! His ideas for the dates, his surveys, his special moments with Emma, and his love for his family were admirable. This book also handles trauma, a toxic parent, and new guardianship. Abby did a great job navigating the not-so-happy moments on the page as well. Loved Maddie and her unwavering support for Emma.  “You can love someone and still not be willing to give up your way of life for them. And then there are those you love who you’d take a bullet for. It’s all the same emotion, just different levels.”  If you are looking for your next book, pick up Abby. She is an auto-buy author and I can’t wait to read more!
body_html:
“The best kind of love doesn't happen on moonlit walks and romantic vacations. It happens in between the folds of everyday life.”

“In a world where you can choose anger or empathy, always choose empathy.”

Read if you Enjoy:
* Lake Vibes
* He Falls First
* Forced Proximity
* Online meet-cute
* Found family
* Dual POV
* Mental Health Awareness/ Trauma

Rating:

“You’re not asking too much,” he said. “You were just asking the wrong person. Ask me instead.”

Abby has done it again! This book was everything I expected and more.

First of all, even though this book can be read as a standalone, I would highly recommend reading Part of Your World and Yours Truly first to understand some of the events/characters that take place in this one. Specifically Part of Your World as the big shocker in the end is connected.

Now on to this review! Justin and Emma meet online through a Reddit post as both characters connect over their unfortunate bad luck in love. You see… every time they date someone and they break up, the exes move on to find the love of their lives. Through a mutual pact, they both agree to date each other and “break” their curse. The rules… four dates, one kiss, and a breakup. Not complicated at all, right?

I loved this book! The amount of meaningful quotes and laugh-out-loud moments had me eating the pages. Justin has become a favorite MMC! His ideas for the dates, his surveys, his special moments with Emma, and his love for his family were admirable. This book also handles trauma, a toxic parent, and new guardianship. Abby did a great job navigating the not-so-happy moments on the page as well. Loved Maddie and her unwavering support for Emma.

“You can love someone and still not be willing to give up your way of life for them. And then there are those you love who you’d take a bullet for. It’s all the same emotion, just different levels.”

If you are looking for your next book, pick up Abby. She is an auto-buy author and I can’t wait to read more!
date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on June 6, 2024
profile.name: Yani

title: Five brilliant, sparkling stars
body: I love Abby Jimenez so much, and after every new book of hers, I wish I could read it again for the first time. She's an absolutely delightful human being, and I'm so lucky to have met her in person.  Just for the Summer is a fun romantic romp with surprising depth. (Well, if you know Abby's writing, it really *isn't* surprising, but you know what I mean.) Justin and Emma both suffer from the same curse--they're the person people date RIGHT BEFORE the other person finds their soulmate. So in an attempt to break the curse, they agree to date--just for the summer--so that they both then can go on to find the person they're meant to be with. Only things don't exactly go according to plan. Instead of keeping things surface level, things quickly get serious between the two. Suddenly, a relationship with an end-date isn't what either one of them really want.  Now--where's the depth, you ask? Trauma. Trauma. And more trauma. Emma survived the foster care system after her flighty, inconstant mother abandoned her one too many times. She has attachment issues, and she keeps her heart completely walled off. Justin is suddenly the legal guardian for his three younger siblings because his mother is serving time in prison for embezzlement. He has a lot on his plate, and falling in love wasn't part of the plan. But--thankfully--plans can change, and therapy can help even the most broken people begin to heal. Oh--and seriously, each book has the most uplifting themes. This book can be summed up in this one quote: "Why not forgive? In a world where you can choose anger or empathy, always choose empathy."  I adored all the cameos and callbacks to Abby's previous books. This one can definitely be read as a stand alone, but I think reading her books in the order they were published would make all those easter eggs more delightful. (Think listening to Tortured Poets as the first Taylor Swift album you've ever listened to versus listening to it with the rest of her catalog in mind. Same concept.)  Five brilliant, sparkling stars, and one hilarious rainbow unicorn floatie. IYKYK.
body_html:

Suddenly, a relationship with an end-date isn't what either one of them really want.

Now--where's the depth, you ask? Trauma. Trauma. And more trauma. Emma survived the foster care system after her flighty, inconstant mother abandoned her one too many times. She has attachment issues, and she keeps her heart completely walled off. Oh--and seriously, each book has the most uplifting themes. This book can be summed up in this one quote: "Why not forgive? In a world where you can choose anger or empathy, always choose empathy."

profile.name: lpmoreland

title: Well worth the time spent reading.
body: I was skeptical at first, sometimes you read a romance and suddenly you have basically read them all. I loved how this story was so down to earth and real. I touched on the reality of a relationship that has flaws, a relationship that can overcome trauma. There were real life scenarios about the hard parts of a relationship no one wants to talk about. It touched base on childhood trauma, unleashed abandonment issues, true friendship, and how to let go. There were so many good paragraphs, the kind that you take to heart and realize it fits into your own past. The kind that makes you tear up for what feels like no reason and suddenly it hits you. One of my favorites was Emma was talking about her mom with Justin; “You don’t have to forgive her. You really don’t. You can still love someone that you’ve decided not to speak to anymore. You can still wish them well and hope for the best for them. Choosing life without them doesn’t mean you stop caring about them. It just means that you can’t allow them to harm you anymore”. There is another line to this but you will just have to read the book and see. No spoilers from me. I thought this book was planned well for each character and the flow of each one fit perfectly into the proper sequences. Emma and Justine belong together and I love how she referred to him as her docking station. I enjoyed the suspense of two people that really enjoyed each other and the people they called family. I will read another book by this author!

date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on May 24, 2024
profile.name: Amazon15

title: FAVORITE BOOK OF 2024 SO FAR
body: 5+ stars  this one is my fav book of the year so far! when I read the short story “with any luck” by ashley poston, I wished it was a full book because I loved the concept so much—well here’s that book!  emma and justin are each cursed. every person they date ends up finding “the one” right after them, so they decide to counteract their curses by dating each other just for the summer. emma—a travel nurse who prefers staying unattached to anyone besides her best friend maddy—and justin—the software engineer whose life is taking a drastic turn—seem to be an unlikely pair. as their friendship grows into something more, both emma and justin have to face their own respective challenges in order to have the chance at being together.  POTENTIAL LIGHT SPOILERS BELOW •••••  I laughed and cried my way through this book because emma and justin do not have any easy road to happiness. I just want to hug emma because she deserves the best and she truly didn’t grow up with that. amber pissed me off so much because of everything she did/does to emma. But I love that despite thinking of herself as on an island alone, emma trusts that she has maddy. Maddy is the best friend we all need!  The romance in this book is 100/10. Justin is absolutely the definition of “If He Wanted To, He Would” because the unicorn floatie?! The dates he plans around really funny surveys?! He is such a great son, brother, and partner to emma. We need more real justins in the world!!!  The twists and turns this story takes are absolutely jaw dropping. I was hooked from the very first page and struggled to put the book down. Abby’s writing is at her absolute best in this book & I love the cameos from her other characters🤭  Above all, I love how real the characters, their emotions, and their journeys felt. I could imagine emma and justin as real people struggling with themselves while trying to navigate a relationship too & I couldn’t help but root for their happily ever after  P.S. if you haven’t already, I highly suggest reading through Abby’s Q&A at the end of the book!
body_html:
5+ stars

this one is my fav book of the year so far! when I read the short story “with any luck” by ashley poston, I wished it was a full book because I loved the concept so much—well here’s that book!

emma and justin are each cursed. every person they date ends up finding “the one” right after them, so they decide to counteract their curses by dating each other just for the summer. emma—a travel nurse who prefers staying unattached to anyone besides her best friend maddy—and justin—the software engineer whose life is taking a drastic turn—seem to be an unlikely pair. as their friendship grows into something more, both emma and justin have to face their own respective challenges in order to have the chance at being together.

POTENTIAL LIGHT SPOILERS BELOW
•••••

I laughed and cried my way through this book because emma and justin do not have any easy road to happiness. I just want to hug emma because she deserves the best and she truly didn’t grow up with that. amber pissed me off so much because of everything she did/does to emma. But I love that despite thinking of herself as on an island alone, emma trusts that she has maddy. Maddy is the best friend we all need!

The romance in this book is 100/10. Justin is absolutely the definition of “If He Wanted To, He Would” because the unicorn floatie?! The dates he plans around really funny surveys?! He is such a great son, brother, and partner to emma. We need more real justins in the world!!!

The twists and turns this story takes are absolutely jaw dropping. I was hooked from the very first page and struggled to put the book down. Abby’s writing is at her absolute best in this book & I love the cameos from her other characters🤭

Above all, I love how real the characters, their emotions, and their journeys felt. I could imagine emma and justin as real people struggling with themselves while trying to navigate a relationship too & I couldn’t help but root for their happily ever after

P.S. if you haven’t already, I highly suggest reading through Abby’s Q&A at the end of the book!
date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on April 17, 2024
profile.name: Bri

title: Just For the Summer
body: Just for the Summer by Abby Jimenez Part of Your World series #3. Contemporary romance. Can be read as a stand-alone. Justin is cursed. Every woman he dates finds their sole mate after breaking up with him. Emma is cursed the same as Jason. Since both want to find love, they come up with a plan to date each other, thus assuring they will both meet their true love when they stage their break up. Justin and Emma find themselves strangely compatible. Even with their lives getting crazy with her mother showing up and Justin assuming guardianship of his three siblings, they are making things work. Is it possible they have found their future?  You knew that answer already! The house on the island that Emma and her roommate rent is unique but I’m not sure I would have been up for the adventure of only being able to boat off the island. Justin needs to get to Emma when she’s sick and nothing will stop him. I fell in love with him at that point. All the feels in this book. You will be cheering them on too. I’ve come to love this author’s stories so much. She’s become an auto-buy.
body_html:

date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2024
profile.name: Madison W Fairbanks

title: It is a Must Read for the summer!!
body: This is one of those "Best of the Summer" books and I was of course skeptical - but it actually lived up to the hype!! I loved the story, the characters and the author's writing style. The book grabbed the reader's attention and didn't let it go!! I loved the premise of this one - it was a bit unique and left the reader wanting to read more!  The book gives us two characters who both feel "cursed" in the love department and find each other and decide to break the curse....but did they? Or did they find the love that they have been missing? The reader will yell, scream and curse the book and author at times and they go through all the emotions. This is one of those books that the reader can't find a stopping point to go about their everyday life...does one really need to cook/eat dinner? I mean what is the priority at this point?!  The reader will alternate between not wanting this one to end and wanting to know what is going to happen next! The reader will also want to become friends with the characters in the story - they can relate to each and every character in some way. It's a good read that will leave the reader thinking about the story long after they finished reading it.

profile.name: Stephenee

title: Perfect Romcom
body: This was my first book by Abby Jimenez and you might ask "What took you so long?!" I don't know why but I loved this book so much! The characters are ones you feel deep into your heart right away. Poor Emma treated so poorly by her mother and yet hoping that things will change. Her mother has screwed her up so badly that she doesn't stay in one place very long. lives as a traveling nurse with her best friend and foster sister Maddy. She believes that she is cursed with the problem of meeting someone only to break up and they find their soulmate right afterward. She read an AITA post from a guy named Justin who believes he has the same problem. They decide to meet up and date for a few dates, just for the summer, to see if when they breakup, they will meet their forever loves. They don't plan on falling for each other and as it happens in these books, they have their troubles but they are so darn cute together!  The writing is so witty, so fun. I laughed out loud many times and got teary a few times as well. Perfect romcom in every way. I will definitely be picking up more of her books.

date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2024
profile.name: Mary Ward

title: Not just a romcon but a lesson on empathy
body: This book had so many incredible messages to share that sink into your soul. The story is great and amazing to read, however, this was such an amazing gift of how to reframe the bad things in your life with empathy and heart. This book will stick with you afterwards as you encounter difficult situations giving you a more positive perspective and giving you the tools to effectively handle the hard things. It will make you realize how many of the little things in your life are actually filled with love. Read this book. It’s worth a reread which I very seldom would ever say. Thank you Abby Jimenez for sharing this story which creates so much food for thought and subtly teaches one to always look for the silver lining and the positive in the moment.

profile.name: Patricia K. Fowle

title: Serious book hangover
body: I absolutely loved this book. Abby Jimenez writes these amazingly human and flawed characters and gives us a slice of their complicated lives. Then she has them fall in love and deal with the realities of modern love. A Captivating and emotional ride. Emma is a traveling nurse who lives and works with her best friend. They come across an AITA posting about a guy (Justin) who is cursed by having every ex girlfriend find their soulmate after they break up. Emma has a similar issue and DMs the guy to commiserate. They strike up an online friendship until Justin suggests that they date each other and breakup so they can both go on to find their soulmate thus breaking the curse. It means Emma and Maddy have to find work and travel to where Justin is living…Just for the summer…to break the curse. Emma is a child of the foster system because she was abandoned by her mother who is bipolar. Getting close to people is very difficult for her and staying in one place is virtually impossible. Justin has family problems of his own. His father died in an accident within the last year or two and his mother is going away for a while leaving Justin to raise his siblings. Justin starts to fall in love with Emma but he comes with kids and Emma never bargained for that. Emma thinks maybe she’d like to try with Justin anyway, but her mother’s drama causes Emma’s trauma to surface. I won’t give away the end but I kept reading way past my bedtime just to find out what happens. Loved: Cinnamon roll Justin He falls first Realistic issues with loving someone with mental health issues. Empathetic heroine Ugly puppy Rescued stuffie  Less loved (barely an inconvenience ) Low spice
body_html:

profile.name: Ana

title: Unputdownable
body: This book was chosen as our book club selection for the month. Our book club consists of 10 women and 2 men. I can’t wait to see their reaction to this book. My reaction is pure joy. The premise of the book was unique, and the characters were so real. Emma was a unique character who seemed like everything was okay when in reality, she had a life full of baggage to deal with… and thanks to her bff Maddy, she smoothed out the rough edges when they showed. Enter Justin who Emma met online by sharing relationship woes with each other. Justin was kind and clever, and I just loved him immediately. Emma and Justin went through some real trials and tribulations, and I admit I went through a bunch of tissues, but it ended beautifully and I couldn’t have loved it more.
body_html:
This book was chosen as our book club selection for the month. Our book club consists of 10 women and 2 men. I can’t wait to see their reaction to this book. My reaction is pure joy. The premise of the book was unique, and the characters were so real. Emma was a unique character who seemed like everything was okay when in reality, she had a life full of baggage to deal with… and thanks to her bff Maddy, she smoothed out the rough edges when they showed. Enter Justin who Emma met online by sharing relationship woes with each other. Justin was kind and clever, and I just loved him immediately.
Emma and Justin went through some real trials and tribulations, and I admit I went through a bunch of tissues, but it ended beautifully and I couldn’t have loved it more.
date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2024
profile.name: Marcia Esders

title: OBSESSED WITH THIS BOOK!  A MUST READ!
body: “𝘐𝘯 𝘢 𝘸𝘰𝘳𝘭𝘥 𝘸𝘩𝘦𝘳𝘦 𝘺𝘰𝘶 𝘤𝘢𝘯 𝘤𝘩𝘰𝘰𝘴𝘦 𝘢𝘯𝘨𝘦𝘳 𝘰𝘳 𝘦𝘮𝘱𝘢𝘵𝘩𝘺, 𝘢𝘭𝘸𝘢𝘺𝘴 𝘤𝘩𝘰𝘰𝘴𝘦 𝘦𝘮𝘱𝘢𝘵𝘩𝘺.”  “𝘠𝘰𝘶 𝘢𝘳𝘦 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘰𝘯𝘭𝘺 𝘵𝘩𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘪𝘯 𝘮𝘺 𝘭𝘪𝘧𝘦 𝘮𝘢𝘬𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘮𝘦 𝘩𝘢𝘱𝘱𝘺 𝘳𝘪𝘨𝘩𝘵 𝘯𝘰𝘸. 𝘈𝘯𝘥 𝘐’𝘮 𝘯𝘰𝘵 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘭𝘦𝘢𝘴𝘵 𝘣𝘪𝘵 𝘢𝘧𝘳𝘢𝘪𝘥 𝘵𝘰 𝘺𝘰𝘶 𝘵𝘩𝘢𝘵.”  “𝘠𝘰𝘶 𝘢𝘳𝘦 𝘯𝘰𝘵 𝘸𝘩𝘢𝘵 𝘩𝘢𝘱𝘱𝘦𝘯𝘦𝘥 𝘵𝘰 𝘺𝘰𝘶. 𝘠𝘰𝘶 𝘢𝘳𝘦 𝘸𝘩𝘢𝘵 𝘺𝘰𝘶 𝘥𝘰 𝘯𝘦𝘹𝘵.”  𝑶𝑴𝑮! This book! 𝘚𝘩𝘪𝘯𝘯𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘴𝘩𝘪𝘮𝘮𝘦𝘳𝘪𝘯𝘨 5 ⭑! ✨ I love 𝗲𝘃𝗲𝗿𝘆𝘁𝗵𝗶𝗻𝗴 about this book! After reading 𝘠𝘰𝘶𝘳𝘴 𝘛𝘳𝘶𝘭𝘺 I had high hopes going into this, and I have to say that this did not disappoint! It is the most 𝐏𝐄𝐑𝐅𝐄𝐂𝐓 romcom book to date! The toilet king references, Justin’s AWESOME dating options and questionnaires, their sweet swoon worthy moments that makes you smile like an idiot, are just the way to my romance loving heart! 🥰 I also want to say to brace yourself, because this also dives into topics of panic attacks, neglect, mental health issues, PTSD, grief, child neglect and dysfunctional family.  𝘑𝘶𝘴𝘵𝘪𝘯 𝘑𝘶𝘴𝘵𝘪𝘯 𝘑𝘶𝘴𝘵𝘪𝘯… this man will quite literally use a unicorn floatie to get to Emma to take care of her while she’s sick! 👏🏼 He will do anything for Emma no matter what. His connection with Emma is so beautiful from the beginning.  I love the growth that Emma showed. The work she’d done to overcome her trauma was both heartbreaking to see but also there is that relief of finally facing those fears!  And lastly, MADDY! You the real MVP! Best freaking friend award goes to her! I love the love that hers and Emma share for each other and the protectiveness that Maddy has towards Emma is just 💯. 𝙔𝙊𝙐 𝙂𝙊 𝙌𝙐𝙀𝙀𝙉!!! 🙌🏼👏🏼  To my romcom girlies, you’re going to 𝙡𝙤𝙫𝙚 this book!  Another great addition to the book are cameos from “𝘗𝘢𝘳𝘵 𝘰𝘧 𝘠𝘰𝘶𝘳 𝘞𝘰𝘳𝘭𝘥” and “𝘠𝘰𝘶𝘳𝘴 𝘛𝘳𝘶𝘭𝘺” characters. Seeing these characters honestly took me by surprise.

“𝘐𝘯 𝘢 𝘸𝘰𝘳𝘭𝘥 𝘸𝘩𝘦𝘳𝘦 𝘺𝘰𝘶 𝘤𝘢𝘯 𝘤𝘩𝘰𝘰𝘴𝘦 𝘢𝘯𝘨𝘦𝘳 𝘰𝘳 𝘦𝘮𝘱𝘢𝘵𝘩𝘺, 𝘢𝘭𝘸𝘢𝘺𝘴 𝘤𝘩𝘰𝘰𝘴𝘦 𝘦𝘮𝘱𝘢𝘵𝘩𝘺.”

“𝘠𝘰𝘶 𝘢𝘳𝘦 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘰𝘯𝘭𝘺 𝘵𝘩𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘪𝘯 𝘮𝘺 𝘭𝘪𝘧𝘦 𝘮𝘢𝘬𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘮𝘦 𝘩𝘢𝘱𝘱𝘺 𝘳𝘪𝘨𝘩𝘵 𝘯𝘰𝘸. 𝘈𝘯𝘥 𝘐’𝘮 𝘯𝘰𝘵 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘭𝘦𝘢𝘴𝘵 𝘣𝘪𝘵 𝘢𝘧𝘳𝘢𝘪𝘥 𝘵𝘰 𝘺𝘰𝘶 𝘵𝘩𝘢𝘵.”

“𝘠𝘰𝘶 𝘢𝘳𝘦 𝘯𝘰𝘵 𝘸𝘩𝘢𝘵 𝘩𝘢𝘱𝘱𝘦𝘯𝘦𝘥 𝘵𝘰 𝘺𝘰𝘶. 𝘠𝘰𝘶 𝘢𝘳𝘦 𝘸𝘩𝘢𝘵 𝘺𝘰𝘶 𝘥𝘰 𝘯𝘦𝘹𝘵.”

It is the most 𝐏𝐄𝐑𝐅𝐄𝐂𝐓 romcom book to date! The toilet king references, Justin’s AWESOME dating options and questionnaires, their sweet swoon worthy moments that makes you smile like an idiot, are just the way to my romance loving heart! 🥰 I also want to say to brace yourself, because this also dives into topics of panic attacks, neglect, mental health issues, PTSD, grief, child neglect and dysfunctional family.

𝘑𝘶𝘴𝘵𝘪𝘯 𝘑𝘶𝘴𝘵𝘪𝘯 𝘑𝘶𝘴𝘵𝘪𝘯… this man will quite literally use a unicorn floatie to get to Emma to take care of her while she’s sick! 👏🏼 He will do anything for Emma no matter what. His connection with Emma is so beautiful from the beginning.

I love the growth that Emma showed. The work she’d done to overcome her trauma was both heartbreaking to see but also there is that relief of finally facing those fears!

And lastly, MADDY! You the real MVP! Best freaking friend award goes to her! I love the love that hers and Emma share for each other and the protectiveness that Maddy has towards Emma is just 💯. 𝙔𝙊𝙐 𝙂𝙊 𝙌𝙐𝙀𝙀𝙉!!! 🙌🏼👏🏼

To my romcom girlies, you’re going to 𝙡𝙤𝙫𝙚 this book!

Another great addition to the book are cameos from “𝘗𝘢𝘳𝘵 𝘰𝘧 𝘠𝘰𝘶𝘳 𝘞𝘰𝘳𝘭𝘥” and “𝘠𝘰𝘶𝘳𝘴 𝘛𝘳𝘶𝘭𝘺” characters. Seeing these characters honestly took me by surprise.

profile.name: Jody Uson

title: not your typical beach read
body: Although I had some struggles with some of the middle of this book, the second half made up for so much of it! At times I felt like the story dragged on and was a little too repetitive, with SO MANY plot lines (but that could just be a me thing or the space my head was in), and it took me almost 2 weeks to finish it which is not common with a romance, especially an Abby Jimenez book.  I loved Justin, Emma, and Maddy. I related in so many ways to Emma and was honestly so triggered anytime Amber was on the page. Emma’s story is one of neglect which was difficult and heartbreaking to read, especially as you began to see how it affects her into her adult life and her friendships/ relationships.  I adored Justin. The effort her showed, his humor and playfulness, his steadiness and care. He was truly a soft place to land for Emma. The rawness and vulnerability this book had brought me to tears multiple times. I could say so much more but overall, really enjoyed the book!  No spoilers but chapters 40/41 hit me HARD. I love Abby!
body_html:

Emma’s story is one of neglect which was difficult and heartbreaking to read, especially as you began to see how it affects her into her adult life and her friendships/ relationships.

I adored Justin. The effort her showed, his humor and playfulness, his steadiness and care. He was truly a soft place to land for Emma. The rawness and vulnerability this book had brought me to tears multiple times. I could say so much more but overall, really enjoyed the book!

No spoilers but chapters 40/41 hit me HARD. I love Abby!

profile.name: Brooks

title: I am addicted to Abby!
body: Ok... I never buy books. I do Kindle Unlimited. But then I read Abby Jimenez "Yours Truly" and was hooked. She writes the most clever, endearing romantic comedy. Her sense of humor lines up with my own so that I laugh out loud, literally, while I'm reading. I usually read crime, action, thriller stuff. To break it up I'll pick something light. This is the second book I have PURCHASED! And I'm sure I'll be shelling out some cash for her other reads. I love how her stories make me feel! Like it's a warm hug and a great time with friends. Especially since her characters all exist in the same world and pop up in other plotlines. I love it! Dammit!

profile.name: Amazon Customer

title: seven million stars
body: I’m going to have to come back in a few days to write a review that truly reflects what this book means to me. I actually cried when I finished it. This is my first read from this author, and I can’t believe I haven’t been reading her books all along.  I have never read a book that truly captures the ripple effect untreated mental illness has. This was a romance book, but to deal with such a sensitive topic with grace and with valid, raw emotions being shown…I am just so glad I read this.

profile.name: Tyler DeBoer

title: Another 5⭐️ read from Abby Jimenez…
body: Abby Jimenez is a rare author I will pay traditional publishing prices to read… because her stories are just THAT good.  📕 𝗕𝗼𝗼𝗸 𝗜𝗻𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗺𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻: Just for the Summer by Abby Jimenez  📙 𝗦𝗲𝗿𝗶𝗲𝘀: Standalone (kinda)  📗 𝗥𝗲𝗮𝗱𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗗𝗲𝘁𝗮𝗶𝗹𝘀: E-book on Kindle. Borrowed from Libby.  📘 𝗚𝗲𝗻𝗿𝗲: Contemporary romance  📔 𝗧𝗿𝗼𝗽𝗲𝘀: Meet cute, she’s a runner, he falls first (and HARD), found family.  📖 𝗦𝘆𝗻𝗼𝗽𝘀𝗶𝘀: Emma is a traveling nurse with a curse - everyone she dates breaks up with her and finds their soul mate immediately after. She meets Justin, who has a similar curse. They decide to date just for the summer to help cancel out their respective bad luck.  🌟 𝗥𝗲𝘃𝗶𝗲𝘄: That synopsis is what the publishers put out, but this story is - like many of Abby Jimenez’s books - so much deeper.  It’s funny and sweet and soooooo romantic, and then deeply emotional and painful and healing all at once. This book hit me like a ton of bricks. It felt cathartic to read.  I always feel like Abby Jimenez’ writing is so intentional. She researches well and has sensitivity readers and makes everything feel both relatable and believable. I told a friend I was genuinely sad for what happened to Emma - and she’s a fictional character.  I’m sure it comes as no surprise to see the five-star rating, but it’s impressive to me nonetheless.  𝗥𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴: 5/5 ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐  𝗦𝗽𝗶𝗰𝗲 𝗟𝗲𝘃𝗲𝗹: 2.5/5 🌶🌶  📝 𝗔 𝗾𝘂𝗶𝗰𝗸 𝗻𝗼𝘁𝗲… I mentioned this is a standalone. But it’s also part of a universe. Highly recommend reading Part of Your World and Yours Truly as well.
body_html:
Abby Jimenez is a rare author I will pay traditional publishing prices to read… because her stories are just THAT good.

📕 𝗕𝗼𝗼𝗸 𝗜𝗻𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗺𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻: Just for the Summer by Abby Jimenez

📙 𝗦𝗲𝗿𝗶𝗲𝘀: Standalone (kinda)

📗 𝗥𝗲𝗮𝗱𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗗𝗲𝘁𝗮𝗶𝗹𝘀: E-book on Kindle. Borrowed from Libby.

📘 𝗚𝗲𝗻𝗿𝗲: Contemporary romance

📔 𝗧𝗿𝗼𝗽𝗲𝘀: Meet cute, she’s a runner, he falls first (and HARD), found family.

📖 𝗦𝘆𝗻𝗼𝗽𝘀𝗶𝘀: Emma is a traveling nurse with a curse - everyone she dates breaks up with her and finds their soul mate immediately after. She meets Justin, who has a similar curse. They decide to date just for the summer to help cancel out their respective bad luck.

🌟 𝗥𝗲𝘃𝗶𝗲𝘄: That synopsis is what the publishers put out, but this story is - like many of Abby Jimenez’s books - so much deeper.

It’s funny and sweet and soooooo romantic, and then deeply emotional and painful and healing all at once. This book hit me like a ton of bricks. It felt cathartic to read.

I always feel like Abby Jimenez’ writing is so intentional. She researches well and has sensitivity readers and makes everything feel both relatable and believable. I told a friend I was genuinely sad for what happened to Emma - and she’s a fictional character.

I’m sure it comes as no surprise to see the five-star rating, but it’s impressive to me nonetheless.

𝗥𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴: 5/5 ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

𝗦𝗽𝗶𝗰𝗲 𝗟𝗲𝘃𝗲𝗹: 2.5/5 🌶🌶

📝 𝗔 𝗾𝘂𝗶𝗰𝗸 𝗻𝗼𝘁𝗲… I mentioned this is a standalone. But it’s also part of a universe. Highly recommend reading Part of Your World and Yours Truly as well.
date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on April 9, 2024
profile.name: Cori / RomancingtheReader

title: loved the FMC
body: Just for the Summer by Abby Jimenez  Good! Felt real. I loved Emma who has such a great attitude even tho her heart is totally walled off to any kind of love. Her expressions; eg "where you can choose anger or empathy, always choose empathy", "if you can frame the terrible things in the best possible way, that’s where true happiness comes from", “You are not what happened to you. You are what you do next”; provide words to live by.  Emma & Justin have come together to break a relationship curse; no feelings or physical involved. Just four dates, a kiss, then a breakup. But feelings fight to assert themselves. However, she's a love averse travel nurse who won't stay put, and he's becoming a full-time parent to his troubled younger siblings. While feelings grow neither have what the other needs.  SPOILER? - - - - -  Justin's father died; mom's going to prison; he'll be a full-time dad soon as well as a f/t software engineer. Emma's mother could be in the running for worst Mom ever leaving her with PTSD and abandonment issues.  - - - - - END SPOILER  As an aside, two antagonists from "Part of Your World" play not insignificant parts in this story.  I enjoyed this story for the touching romance, good feelings, and maybe I learned some character building attitudes.  PS, Maddy HAS to get her own story (w/ Doug?).
body_html:
Just for the Summer by Abby Jimenez

Good! Felt real. I loved Emma who has such a great attitude even tho her heart is totally walled off to any kind of love. Her expressions; eg "where you can choose anger or empathy, always choose empathy", "if you can frame the terrible things in the best possible way, that’s where true happiness comes from", “You are not what happened to you. You are what you do next”; provide words to live by.

Emma & Justin have come together to break a relationship curse; no feelings or physical involved. Just four dates, a kiss, then a breakup. But feelings fight to assert themselves. However, she's a love averse travel nurse who won't stay put, and he's becoming a full-time parent to his troubled younger siblings. While feelings grow neither have what the other needs.

SPOILER?
- - - - -

Justin's father died; mom's going to prison; he'll be a full-time dad soon as well as a f/t software engineer. Emma's mother could be in the running for worst Mom ever leaving her with PTSD and abandonment issues.

- - - - -
END SPOILER

As an aside, two antagonists from "Part of Your World" play not insignificant parts in this story.

I enjoyed this story for the touching romance, good feelings, and maybe I learned some character building attitudes.

PS, Maddy HAS to get her own story (w/ Doug?).
date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2024
profile.name: danimaldjb

title: Amazing book
body: I love Abby Jimenez's books because it's about more than the romance. There's always much deeper themes and the characters are always really fleshed out, and very human with trauma and things that they have been through and need to overcome in order to find the love they deserve. This was no exception, and I just love what the author did with this story. Justin and Emma both have their own stuff, and it's a LOT but at the core of it all is that they both gravitate toward each other because they share the same curse: after each person they date, that person goes on to find the love of their life. So, Justin and Emma decide to "date", then break up, in an attempt to break the curse and both go on to find their own soulmates. But what begins as a just an adventure to break their fate leads them down the path they're actually supposed to be on. I loved Justin and his Golden Retriever energy and how sweet he was with everyone. He always let Emma and his siblings know how important they are to him, and never hesitated to step up to the plate. Emma was someone I related to, because that avoidant attachment is so hard to heal from, but Justin was there for her every step of the way. I absolutely LOVED the connection with Briana, Jacob, Alexis, Daniel and others from previous books by Abby Jimenez. It made me SO happy to see everyone again! It was like coming home and seeing your family, and Yours Truly is one of my favorite books EVER so I was ecstatic that it all tied together. I just love this book so much and enjoyed every minute of it.

date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2024
profile.name: KL

title: How big is your island???
body: This book was equal parts hilarious and heartbreaking, but definitely emotional. I am pretty hard on heroes and heroines who don’t think (i.e. unnecessarily helpless or rash), and the development and journey of these characters kept me intrigued to say the least. I have seen some of this IRL, so I honestly can see the scenarios in this story totally being real (a sad and scary truth). A lot is thrown at Emma and Justin while working on this experiment, so the fallout and reactions had no choice but to be big. Definitely a story worth reading and examining. Don’t let the book title fool you… this is not a just summer fluff story.

profile.name: VG

title: A pleasant surprise.
body: This book had me in a choke hold. I had seen the book cover floating around my Audible app for some time. I also watched a brief interview of the author on one of the morning talk shows, maybe CBS? I like to leave the tv on for the cat and dog to watch Price is Right when I’m gone for work. Anyway, I listened to a few minutes of the book on Spotify and immediately decided I wanted to read the book. In my impatience, not willing to wait for a hard copy, I downloaded the Kindle app and subsequently, the book. While I was busy running errands and couldn’t sit to read, I listened to the story. I was giggling, gaping and tearing up while driving, chopping herbs for a marinade and paying bills. I finally sat down to read and didn’t stop until midnight. I woke up this morning and immediately began to listen again. I read during any down time I had, and just finished the book moments ago. There are nuggets of wisdom sprinkled throughout this book that can only be thought up and written by someone with a complex, yet kind, heart. This is a heart-breaking story about love, a deep understanding of one’s self, and people’s compassion for one another, especially for one’s chose family. 12/10 recommend.

I also watched a brief interview of the author on one of the morning talk shows, maybe CBS? I like to leave the tv on for the cat and dog to watch Price is Right when I’m gone for work. Anyway, I listened to a few minutes of the book on Spotify and immediately decided I wanted to read the book. profile.name: KyleeWells

title: GMA Selected a Winner!
body: So many book clubs from celebrities to network shows, but sometimes the selected books invite conversations and reflections while delivering great characters, meaningful conflicts, and relevant themes. And this story begins with a joking banter from unlikely pair who agree to meet to test a theory about a supposedly curse they share about never becoming seriously attracted or in love with the person they date, but always being the gateway deliverer of the former relationship partner’s happily ever after.  What could go wrong with a just-for-the-summer relationship?

profile.name: sharon f. leff

title: I'm a convert!
body: I will preface that this is not my typical genre. I lean toward sci-fi, fantasy, and books with a more dark and moody edge.  I follow Abby Jimenez on TikTok; I love her dog, she's funny, her kids are great, etc. I finally decided to spring on this latest release and I'm so glad I did.  Relatable: We all have Moms, some better than others. Regardless, there's this undeniable power they wield, whether they're right there with them or miles away. As a mom myself, reading this book made me think a little more about the influence we have over our kids. It digs deep into the consequences of not living up to that responsibility, and how forgiveness and acceptance aren't always straightforward.  It also speaks to the long-term impact of unaddressed trauma.  Emotional: I found myself chuckling one moment and reaching for the tissues the next.  Pace: It tackles tough topics in a way that feels manageable yet not overwhelming. Clear storytelling with continuous movement through discovery without feeling stuck in one place for too long.  Current: Effortlessly taps into the spirit of today without feeling forced.  In closing, I'm off to read another book by Abby Jimenez.

profile.name: Jenn D

title: sweet and sour
body: There was a lot of hard in this surprisingly funny and heart warming book. With both our leads lives rooted in trauma both past and current you wouldn’t expect such a lighthearted romance but that’s what we found with this book.  I would’ve done five stars but I felt myself wanting more quite a few times. I wanted more scenes with Sarah. I wanted more of a reunion than such a fast resolution. I wanted closure with Neil. I felt like we needed more but I also finished the book fully sated so maybe that’s just a testament of Jimenez that I was wanting more.  Seeing Daniel and Alexis again from part of your world was a fun and shocking bonus.

profile.name: Here4thehea

title: One of my favorite books of the year so far
body: I love every piece of this book — the plot, the characters, everything. Emma and Justin were made for each other but sometimes the timing of meeting someone just doesn’t work out. This book was a great example of the perfect people, but not the perfect time. Emma and Justin understand each other and understand that life happens. The only difference is where Justin can adapt and overcome, Emma struggles with the adjustment.  A lot of Emma’s issues in her adult life directly reflect on how she was treated in her childhood. The one constant in her life has always been her best friend Maddy, who helps Emma grow and regain control over herself throughout the book. Their friendship is so pure and raw, there’s no judgement just support. Everyone needs a friend like Maddy in their life.  This book was truly amazing and I will be thinking about it for a long time! I can’t wait to read more books by Abby Jimenez.
