The storyline is entertaining but also explores the difficult topics of trauma from being abandoned as a child and striving to live a full life despite it.

Having had a difficult childhood myself, I could really relate to Emma's desire to be small and invisible. I thought this was portrayed in a very authentic manner.

I thoroughly enjoyed this book and can’t wait for my copy to arrive, as this book is definitely a keeper. My biggest dilemma now is waiting for the author's next book – UGH.
date.raw: Reviewed in Canada on 22 April 2024
profile.name: Sharon

title: Oh my gosh! The EMOTIONS!!!
body: When I saw that Abby Jimenez had a new 2024 release, I was excited to read it. I enjoyed Yours Truly, her previous release. It ended up on my favourite lists recently, so I had high expectations for Just For The Summer. For me, Abby Jimenez is an expert at the quiet, realistic romances. When I read her books, I believe the characters could actually exist in the world. Her books also tend to pull on real-world emotions and experiences, which make her stories extremely impactful. As a result, I expected a similar reading experience with Just for the Summer, and I was not disappointed. The strongest aspect of Just for the Summer would have to be the characters. Both the main protagonists and the side characters are well-developed, interesting, and realistic. While there are some plot-driven elements to the story, such as the short time frame that Emma and Justin have together, it is their characters that truly drive the story.  Emma was one of my favourite female protagonists that I have read recently. She was a well-thought out character with a strong character arc who shows a lot of growth from beginning to end. Emma lacks a strong emotional attachment to those around her due to her mother’s narcissistic and absent nature during her childhood. As a result, Emma doesn’t always make the “likeable” decision, but she always makes a decision true to her character. Justin is also a strong character with a developed backstory. After his father’s death, Justin’s mother commits a crime and is sentenced to six years in prison. Consequently, he must take over a parental role with his three younger siblings. Justin is the kind of character that I love to see as a romantic interest. He was stable, sweet, and respectful of Emma. However, he also was clear with what he wanted in a relationship with Emma and was honest when her actions affected him negatively. The side characters, particularly Emma’s mother, were also well-developed. Emma’s mother, Amber, was not a likeable person whatsoever, but she was incredibly realistic. I think Jimenez did an excellent job of making her the “villain,” but not cartoon-ish. It was also interesting to see characters from previous novels, such as Neil, and what happened to his character after Part of Your World. Another aspect that I enjoyed was the romance. As I mentioned previously, Jimenez does a great job with quiet, realistic romances. Sometimes, it feels like characters are thrown together simply because they are the main characters in a romance novel, but that isn’t the case in this book. Emma and Justin challenge each other’s ideas about life and love. They are exactly what the other person needed out of a relationship. Emma taught Justin to be more empathetic, and Justin taught Emma that there would be people who would stick beside her, no matter what.  Finally, I loved this book of the strong emotional connection that I had to this novel. Like I mentioned earlier, Jimenez always pulls on real-world feelings and emotions that make her stories more impactful. Just for the Summer was no exception. I found myself crying multiple times throughout the story because of how Emma’s story was so heartbreaking and realistic, but also how beautiful and hopeful it was.  Final Thoughts  Overall, I loved this story. Abby Jimenez is quickly becoming an auto-buy author for me. I give this book five out of five stars.
body_html:
When I saw that Abby Jimenez had a new 2024 release, I was excited to read it. I enjoyed Yours Truly, her previous release. It ended up on my favourite lists recently, so I had high expectations for Just For The Summer.
For me, Abby Jimenez is an expert at the quiet, realistic romances. When I read her books, I believe the characters could actually exist in the world. Her books also tend to pull on real-world emotions and experiences, which make her stories extremely impactful. As a result, I expected a similar reading experience with Just for the Summer, and I was not disappointed.
The strongest aspect of Just for the Summer would have to be the characters. Both the main protagonists and the side characters are well-developed, interesting, and realistic. While there are some plot-driven elements to the story, such as the short time frame that Emma and Justin have together, it is their characters that truly drive the story.

Emma was one of my favourite female protagonists that I have read recently. She was a well-thought out character with a strong character arc who shows a lot of growth from beginning to end. Emma lacks a strong emotional attachment to those around her due to her mother’s narcissistic and absent nature during her childhood. As a result, Emma doesn’t always make the “likeable” decision, but she always makes a decision true to her character.
Justin is also a strong character with a developed backstory. After his father’s death, Justin’s mother commits a crime and is sentenced to six years in prison. Consequently, he must take over a parental role with his three younger siblings. Justin is the kind of character that I love to see as a romantic interest. He was stable, sweet, and respectful of Emma. However, he also was clear with what he wanted in a relationship with Emma and was honest when her actions affected him negatively.
The side characters, particularly Emma’s mother, were also well-developed. Emma’s mother, Amber, was not a likeable person whatsoever, but she was incredibly realistic. I think Jimenez did an excellent job of making her the “villain,” but not cartoon-ish. It was also interesting to see characters from previous novels, such as Neil, and what happened to his character after Part of Your World.
Another aspect that I enjoyed was the romance. As I mentioned previously, Jimenez does a great job with quiet, realistic romances. Sometimes, it feels like characters are thrown together simply because they are the main characters in a romance novel, but that isn’t the case in this book. Emma and Justin challenge each other’s ideas about life and love. They are exactly what the other person needed out of a relationship. Emma taught Justin to be more empathetic, and Justin taught Emma that there would be people who would stick beside her, no matter what.

Finally, I loved this book of the strong emotional connection that I had to this novel. Like I mentioned earlier, Jimenez always pulls on real-world feelings and emotions that make her stories more impactful. Just for the Summer was no exception. I found myself crying multiple times throughout the story because of how Emma’s story was so heartbreaking and realistic, but also how beautiful and hopeful it was.

Final Thoughts

Overall, I loved this story. Abby Jimenez is quickly becoming an auto-buy author for me. I give this book five out of five stars.

profile.name: Elle

title: Justin is the perfect book boyfriend !
body: I loved the beginning of the book. It was funny. The characters were adorable. The story was interesting. I was eager to see how the dates would go and how their relationship would evolve. I usually don’t like love at first sight but Justin and Emma had a great chemistry and the communication between them was perfect. There is no plot in this book. The story is all about understanding your trauma, your past and learn how to grow up and move on. There were a lot of feelings and emotions. But, the story could have been shorter. After the first 60% of the book,the story goes around in circle and I was a bit bored sometimes. I understand the author’s choice but I don’t agree with the ending drama.You can heal and stay with the people you love, just sayin. Even if it was not perfect, it was a great read ! I think I’m gonna keep reading books from Abby Jimenez.

title: Somehow comical and touching! Great Read!
body: At the time of writing this, I can say this is hands down my favorite 2024 book thus far. This hook was both comical and touching. Silly and deep. Tragic and uplifting. All of the characters were incredibly well developed. I instantly felt for both Justin and Emma. I loved the varying family dynamics including chosen family elements too! I thought this book beautifully tackled every day struggles with mental health. Several times the book actually moved me to tears. Justin is basically the perfect man and Emma was so beautifully raw. What a fantastic story. Highly highly recommend!

profile.name: Tara D

title: A heartbreaking but ultimately uplifting story of love and found family.
body: REVIEW cw: panic attacks, anxiety, PTSD, depression, grief, undiagnosed mental health issues, toxic parenting, past child neglect Emma and Justin have something in common: they're always the person someone dates right before they find The One. When Emma reads Justin's viral Reddit AITA thread, an idea is formed. What if they dated each other? Maybe they'd finally break their respective curses, and then find their own true loves. Abby Jimenez always puts my emotions through the wringer, in the best possible way. She also writes the softest book boyfriends, and Justin immediately stole my heart. He was such a cinnamon roll, hilariously funny but also self-deprecating. I loved the graphics and questionnaires he sent to Emma, and his nervousness on the first date was so adorable. And honestly? Best. First. Date. EVER. Also? If a man wouldn't come to my rescue on a rainbow unicorn floatie, I don’t want him! I loved how much he cared about the people around him, and I found chapter thirty-two profoundly beautiful. Meanwhile, chapter nineteen made me laugh and cry in equal measure. The raccoon situation was too funny. But chapter twenty-one? I bawled. I loved that Justin was so transparent about his feelings, despite his own emotional baggage. He was SUCH a good man. And that birthday gift? Utter perfection. I adored Justin's friends. I loved that Benny (yes, THAT Benny) and Brad were so supportive of Justin. The whole Brad situation was hilarious. Faith's constant exasperation with Justin's dog's name was amusing. But more than that, both Benny and Brad were sweethearts, and I loved how much they cared about Justin and his family. Speaking of supporting characters, I loved all of the friendships in this book. Maddy was hilarious. Her vetting of Justin was peak friendship, and all of her dating theories were hilariously brilliant. But I also felt her frustration with Emma and how she continually gave her mum (Amber) a pass. I appreciated that she made sure to point out how Amber was so neglectful of Emma, and I could feel her hurt at times. But she was also THE most loyal, supportive friend and I loved how much she cared about Emma, and rooted for her relationship with Justin, as well as helping him understand Emma's trauma. I went on quite a journey with my feelings for Emma. I was simultaneously heartbroken for and frustrated with her for quite some time. On one hand, I couldn't even begin to imagine how difficult her childhood must have been. Her resilience was commendable, and while I empathised with her, and in many ways could understand her blind hope in her mother, her resistance to what was glaringly obvious at times frustrated me, especially surrounding Amber's behaviour. Still, I'm glad Emma finally opened herself up to love and stability, and I adored how natural she was with Justin's siblings, even when she was struggling. I loved the metaphors with the rose bush and the island. And that twist! It completely reframed my feelings about Emma, and I finished the story loving her. There were some amazing little Easter eggs from other Abby books. Amber's new boyfriend SHOOK ME, and as for what happened in chapter forty? (no spoilers, but OMG. I was screaming, but also SO angry on Emma's behalf). That chapter absolutely BROKE me, and I'm still not over it. I also loved that Abby didn't take the easy option afterwards, even though I sobbed for most of the rest of the book. Thankfully, she always guarantees a HEA, and this one was perfect, so even though i was emotionally drained by the end, I was also intensely happy. A heartbreaking but ultimately uplifting story of love and found family. Stock up on tissues!  Overall Rating: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️ Heat Rating: 🔥
body_html:
REVIEW
cw: panic attacks, anxiety, PTSD, depression, grief, undiagnosed mental health issues, toxic parenting, past child neglect
Emma and Justin have something in common: they're always the person someone dates right before they find The One. When Emma reads Justin's viral Reddit AITA thread, an idea is formed. What if they dated each other? Maybe they'd finally break their respective curses, and then find their own true loves.
Abby Jimenez always puts my emotions through the wringer, in the best possible way. She also writes the softest book boyfriends, and Justin immediately stole my heart. He was such a cinnamon roll, hilariously funny but also self-deprecating. I loved the graphics and questionnaires he sent to Emma, and his nervousness on the first date was so adorable. And honestly? Best. First. Date. EVER. Also? If a man wouldn't come to my rescue on a rainbow unicorn floatie, I don’t want him! I loved how much he cared about the people around him, and I found chapter thirty-two profoundly beautiful. Meanwhile, chapter nineteen made me laugh and cry in equal measure. The raccoon situation was too funny. But chapter twenty-one? I bawled. I loved that Justin was so transparent about his feelings, despite his own emotional baggage. He was SUCH a good man. And that birthday gift? Utter perfection.
I adored Justin's friends. I loved that Benny (yes, THAT Benny) and Brad were so supportive of Justin. The whole Brad situation was hilarious. Faith's constant exasperation with Justin's dog's name was amusing. But more than that, both Benny and Brad were sweethearts, and I loved how much they cared about Justin and his family. Speaking of supporting characters, I loved all of the friendships in this book. Maddy was hilarious. Her vetting of Justin was peak friendship, and all of her dating theories were hilariously brilliant. But I also felt her frustration with Emma and how she continually gave her mum (Amber) a pass. I appreciated that she made sure to point out how Amber was so neglectful of Emma, and I could feel her hurt at times. But she was also THE most loyal, supportive friend and I loved how much she cared about Emma, and rooted for her relationship with Justin, as well as helping him understand Emma's trauma.
I went on quite a journey with my feelings for Emma. I was simultaneously heartbroken for and frustrated with her for quite some time. On one hand, I couldn't even begin to imagine how difficult her childhood must have been. Her resilience was commendable, and while I empathised with her, and in many ways could understand her blind hope in her mother, her resistance to what was glaringly obvious at times frustrated me, especially surrounding Amber's behaviour. Still, I'm glad Emma finally opened herself up to love and stability, and I adored how natural she was with Justin's siblings, even when she was struggling. I loved the metaphors with the rose bush and the island. And that twist! It completely reframed my feelings about Emma, and I finished the story loving her.
There were some amazing little Easter eggs from other Abby books. Amber's new boyfriend SHOOK ME, and as for what happened in chapter forty? (no spoilers, but OMG. I was screaming, but also SO angry on Emma's behalf). That chapter absolutely BROKE me, and I'm still not over it. I also loved that Abby didn't take the easy option afterwards, even though I sobbed for most of the rest of the book. Thankfully, she always guarantees a HEA, and this one was perfect, so even though i was emotionally drained by the end, I was also intensely happy.
A heartbreaking but ultimately uplifting story of love and found family. Stock up on tissues!

Overall Rating: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️

profile.name: Jen

title: "Always choose empathy"
body: "The best kind of love doesn't happen on moonlit walks and romantic vacations. It happens in between the folds of everyday life.”  Another fabulous, unique, slowburn RomCom from Abby Jimenez set at a summer cottage on the lake, full of insightful depth and emotions and just the right amount of spice!  I’m a huge fan of Abby’s writing style and how well she develops her characters in all her books. This book was no different. Emma, the FMC, has a fear of long term commitment due to childhood trauma. Her character wasn’t easy to connect with at the beginning but I feel like it was written this way to show how hard it was for her to connect and trust people. As the story unfolds it is easier to understand why the traveling nurse is slow to trust and has a fear of long term commitments. I loved Emma’s best friend Maddy and her no nonsense, overprotective but hilarious personality. Then there’s Justin…a perfect selfless gentleman/boyfriend who isn’t afraid of a commitment, no matter the cost. He is resilient and always puts everyone else’s needs before his own.  I appreciate that Abby isn’t afraid to include the topic of mental health and trauma in her books. The layers of emotion and trauma are raw, but realistic, and are presented in an accurate but sensitive way. She shows the effects that trauma has on relationships are real and not something to take lightly. There are some heavy topics and complex family dynamics but there’s also found family, which is always uplifting and heartwarming.  This is the third book in the Part of Your World series. I suggest reading them in order so you can catch all the Easter eggs hidden within this book but you could definitely read it as a standalone as well. Don’t skip over the Q&A with the author at the end of the book, it is very insightful.

profile.name: Plans2Read

title: Captivating Characters and Seamless Storytelling: A Review of 'Just for the Summer' by Abby Jimenez
body: "Just for the Summer" by Abby Jimenez captivated me from start to finish, earning its place as one of the best stories I've ever read. Emma and Justin's characters were so compelling, which is rare for me as I don't easily connect with heroines in books. Their struggles were portrayed with such depth that it added a wonderful layer of conflict to the narrative.  I particularly enjoyed the incorporation of the Reddit post, which added a hilarious and authentic touch. The recurring question of "Am I the A-hole?" provided a delightful comic element throughout the story. Jimenez's storytelling prowess truly shines here, seamlessly blending humor with moments that evoked genuine tears from me.  What struck me most was the seamless connection to the first book, "Part of Your World." It prompted me to revisit the earlier story, realizing how much I had forgotten. Upon rereading both books, I found myself even more enamored with "Just for the Summer."  Our international book club had a riveting discussion about the characters, particularly Amber, whose complexity led us to ponder whether she was a narcissist, bipolar, or a blend of both. The depth and believability of the characters sparked conversations as if they were real individuals rather than fictional creations.  Experiencing the book through both Kindle and Audible, narrated by Christine Lakin and Zachary Weber, was a treat. Both narrators brought the story to life with their exceptional talent, enhancing the overall experience.  I wholeheartedly recommend any book penned by Abby Jimenez. Her storytelling prowess and ability to craft multidimensional characters make her a must-read author for me.
body_html:
"Just for the Summer" by Abby Jimenez captivated me from start to finish, earning its place as one of the best stories I've ever read. Emma and Justin's characters were so compelling, which is rare for me as I don't easily connect with heroines in books. Their struggles were portrayed with such depth that it added a wonderful layer of conflict to the narrative.

I particularly enjoyed the incorporation of the Reddit post, which added a hilarious and authentic touch. The recurring question of "Am I the A-hole?" provided a delightful comic element throughout the story. Jimenez's storytelling prowess truly shines here, seamlessly blending humor with moments that evoked genuine tears from me.

What struck me most was the seamless connection to the first book, "Part of Your World." It prompted me to revisit the earlier story, realizing how much I had forgotten. Upon rereading both books, I found myself even more enamored with "Just for the Summer."

Our international book club had a riveting discussion about the characters, particularly Amber, whose complexity led us to ponder whether she was a narcissist, bipolar, or a blend of both. The depth and believability of the characters sparked conversations as if they were real individuals rather than fictional creations.

Experiencing the book through both Kindle and Audible, narrated by Christine Lakin and Zachary Weber, was a treat. Both narrators brought the story to life with their exceptional talent, enhancing the overall experience.

I wholeheartedly recommend any book penned by Abby Jimenez. Her storytelling prowess and ability to craft multidimensional characters make her a must-read author for me.

title: I wanted it to be a 5
body: When I started reading this book, I was instantly hooked. I love when a MMC falls first. Their story was perfect and I loved the dynamic with Maddy too. The humor was spot on! My issue lies with the last 25% of the story. It was meant to show the hardships in life and the difficulty of overcoming it. I found it very meh…. The separation wasn’t necessary and the mom took up too much of the plot. I would have loved to read more about their life and little family.

profile.name: Abby

title: Abby never disappoints!
body: I loooooved this book and it may be my favourite Abby Jimenez book yet. I really enjoy that all the books are connected (especially this one) and it’s really rewarding following all the characters and getting updates. Justin is one of the first book boyfriends to give me butterflies in a long time and Emma was a very complex female character dealing with real issues that she has to work through before getting her happily ever after. One of the things that makes me love Jimenez’s writing is how she deals with real life, complicated issues that the average person also deals with. Her books don’t feel far fetched or cheesy because I could see myself being any one of her characters. I also appreciate that the endings to her books are realistic and don’t suddenly discard all the previous obstacles and are true to the characters development!

profile.name: Kindle Customer

title: A Wonderful, Heartfelt Love Story
body: Emma and Justin are cursed. Every time each of them dates someone else that person finds their soulmate immediately after. After Justin writes a thread on Reddit, the two of them find each other and decide to date each other in hopes they will both find their own soulmates. What they don't expect is to be drawn to each other more than they ever thought possible. After meeting, they both go through their own family hardships, and luckily they are both there to help each other out in ways they never imagined.  I LOVED this book and could not put down. I fell in love with both of the characters, especially Justin who is just too good to be true (my favorite in a book). I laughed and I cried. It was a wonderful, heartfelt story that has a sweet love story, but also hardships for people with mental health problems. I thought it was very well-written and I was never bored. I did find out that it goes with two other books and I think I would have liked to read them first but did not seem to miss them while reading this story. If you love a good story about two characters who have a rough life but find each other, then this is the book for you! I highly recommend!

profile.name: KT Walsh

title: Abby’s best
body: another abby book, another forever favorite.  this book hit so hard for me. emma is a traveling nurse hopping from place to place and never setting down. justin is about to become a single guardian to his three younger siblings and needs stability. when a reddit AITA post brings them together, they realize that they both have a curse: every person they date and breakup with finds their The One immediately after them. their solution? four dates, a kiss, and a breakup. just for the summer.  abby’s writing and her character building is honestly exquisite. every character she brings to life is full of life and nuance, and emma and justin are some of the best characters that are going to stay with me for a very long time. because of emma’s upbringing, she’s closed off and aloof. justin just needs her to meet him where he is. and their story is one of building trust and friendship while fighting the insane connection the two of them share.  this book had me in giggles one minute and tears the next. it is heavy, emotional, and full of so much heart. abby’s mental health rep is always so spot on, and she blew me out of the water with this one. emma is a deeply flawed fmc, and her journey was so powerful. and justin was literally perfect. these characters are so nuanced and written with such intentionality I didn’t have a choice to fall in love with them.
body_html:

profile.name: melanie martel

title: Beautifully written
body: "You're not asking for too much. You were just asking the wrong person. Ask me instead."  This book was another win for me by Abby! It was beautiful! This book is about healing from the trauma that is placed on you by others. And is it worth letting those people stay in your life if you're constanting having to put yourself back together after the damage they cause over and over again! So much of this book I could relate to! Which hit so hard! I'm always so grateful for writers like Abby, who put words to emotions I've never been able to!  ☀️  Justin and Emma struggle with the same curse. Whoever they date, the next person they date falls in love with their soul mate!  Emma was used to running. Never putting down roots so she never had to lose anything. So when Justin offers a deal to break their curse together, she agrees, knowing it'll only be temporary. Because temporary she could do. Temporary was her normal!  But Emma wasn't expecting to find a safe place in Justin. And that was scarier than she could have ever imagined. But slowly, Justin shows her what it was like to have someone who is constant and what it feels like to be wanted.  ☀️  A few of my favorite parts: (I tried very hard not to include spoilers but read with caution or dont)  -Justin was such an overthinker, and I loved it!-  “I’m thinking that I like you a lot more than I thought I would. I’m thinking that I probably smell because it’s hot and all my deodorant washed off in the pool, and that this place would be the perfect place to kiss you like I’m supposed to, but I wouldn’t because of the deodorant thing. I’m thinking that this whole thing with your mom and Neil feels weird, and I can’t put my finger on why. I’m thinking that I don’t like her because she’s ignoring you for some guy she just met, and I feel bad that I don’t like her because I know you do. And then I’m wondering if I’m too hard on people, because I can’t stop thinking about what you said earlier, that you should always choose empathy, and if you can choose empathy with someone like that, I should be able to do it with people I love—but I can’t. I’m thinking your bathing suit looks too tight, and it looks uncomfortable like it’s going to leave lines on your skin. I’m thinking about what those lines would look like when you take it off—not in a sexual way, but also sort of in a sexual way.” I felt my face starting to heat up a little. “Aaaaand now I’m wondering if I’ve said too much and what you’re thinking.”  -His surveys were one of my favorite parts of the book. It was perfectly nerdy, and I loved it!‐  "1. On a scale from Awkward to Charming, how would you rate Justin’s performance?"  -Everyone needs a friend like Maddy! She loved Emma so fiercely. And always knew exactly how to handle her when she fell apart. Even if she didn't agree with the way Emma handled a situation, she was always there to pick her up in the end.-  "Has Maddy ever killed anyone?" She pretended to think about it. "Nobody I can prove." I was cracking up at her threatening him.  “I want you to know that your empathy is beautiful, Emma. I hope you never lose that. I do hope that one day you get some boundaries though.”  -Emma's relationship with her mom was heartbreaking!-  "So I became an island-and the island is small. I don't need anyone. And I know that sounds sort of terrible, but it's actualy comforting to know that I have this ability to need no one. It feels like a superpower. Like I'm untouchable."  -I loved Justin's mothers relationship with her best friend, Leigh. Abby always does such an incredible job with her side characters. Not only do you connect with her main characters. But her aide characters are always wonderful!‐  “Emma, you want to hold one?” Mom asked. She gasped. “Yes!” A hand emerged from the back seat with a tiny chittering raccoon in it wrapped in a bar towel. “This is George Cooney.” Emma took it and held it to her chest and looked at me with hearts in her eyes. “Look at his little hands!”  -There are just so many beautiful parts of this book! But one of my favorite qoutes were....  “Unhealed trauma is a crack. And all the little hard things that trickle into it that would have rolled off someone else, settle. Then when life gets cold, that crack gets bigger, longer, deeper. It makes new breaks. You don’t know how broken she was or what she was trying to do to fill those cracks. Being broken is not an excuse for bad behavior, you still have to make good choices and do the right thing. But it can be the reason. And sometimes understanding the reason can be what helps you heal.”  "The best kind of love doesn’t happen on moonlit walks and romantic vacations. It happens in between the folds of everyday life. It’s not grand gestures that show how you feel, it’s all the little secret things you do to make her life better that you never tell her about."  -I usually am dreading Abby's 3rd act breakups! But this time I loved it. The growth that came from it was so needed and the book wouldn't have been the same without it. Was it heartbreaking to read? 1000% But this time it was as beautiful as it was heartbreaking!-  -AND I CANT FORGET THE EASTER EGGS!! I have to admit I didn't see any of those twists coming. But to see that come full circle was pretty cool!  I also listened to the audio after reading the book and it was an incredible performance by Chrstine Lakin and Zachary Webber!! They were the perfect voices for these two characters!
body_html:
"You're not asking for too much. You were just asking the wrong person. Ask me instead."

This book was another win for me by Abby! It was beautiful!
This book is about healing from the trauma that is placed on you by others. And is it worth letting those people stay in your life if you're constanting having to put yourself back together after the damage they cause over and over again!
So much of this book I could relate to! Which hit so hard! I'm always so grateful for writers like Abby, who put words to emotions I've never been able to!

☀️

Justin and Emma struggle with the same curse. Whoever they date, the next person they date falls in love with their soul mate!

Emma was used to running. Never putting down roots so she never had to lose anything. So when Justin offers a deal to break their curse together, she agrees, knowing it'll only be temporary. Because temporary she could do. Temporary was her normal!

But Emma wasn't expecting to find a safe place in Justin. And that was scarier than she could have ever imagined. But slowly, Justin shows her what it was like to have someone who is constant and what it feels like to be wanted.

☀️

A few of my favorite parts:
(I tried very hard not to include spoilers but read with caution or dont)

-Justin was such an overthinker, and I loved it!-

“I’m thinking that I like you a lot more than I thought I would. I’m thinking that I probably smell because it’s hot and all my deodorant washed off in the pool, and that this place would be the perfect place to kiss you like I’m supposed to, but I wouldn’t because of the deodorant thing. I’m thinking that this whole thing with your mom and Neil feels weird, and I can’t put my finger on why. I’m thinking that I don’t like her because she’s ignoring you for some guy she just met, and I feel bad that I don’t like her because I know you do. And then I’m wondering if I’m too hard on people, because I can’t stop thinking about what you said earlier, that you should always choose empathy, and if you can choose empathy with someone like that, I should be able to do it with people I love—but I can’t. I’m thinking your bathing suit looks too tight, and it looks uncomfortable like it’s going to leave lines on your skin. I’m thinking about what those lines would look like when you take it off—not in a sexual way, but also sort of in a sexual way.” I felt my face starting to heat up a little. “Aaaaand now I’m wondering if I’ve said too much and what you’re thinking.”

-His surveys were one of my favorite parts of the book. It was perfectly nerdy, and I loved it!‐

"1. On a scale from Awkward to Charming, how would you rate Justin’s performance?"

-Everyone needs a friend like Maddy! She loved Emma so fiercely. And always knew exactly how to handle her when she fell apart. Even if she didn't agree with the way Emma handled a situation, she was always there to pick her up in the end.-

"Has Maddy ever killed anyone?"
She pretended to think about it. "Nobody I can prove." I was cracking up at her threatening him.

“I want you to know that your empathy is beautiful, Emma. I hope you never lose that. I do hope that one day you get some boundaries though.”

-Emma's relationship with her mom was heartbreaking!-

"So I became an island-and the island is small. I don't need anyone. And I know that sounds sort of terrible, but it's actualy comforting to know that I have this ability to need no one. It feels
like a superpower. Like I'm untouchable."

-I loved Justin's mothers relationship with her best friend, Leigh. Abby always does such an incredible job with her side characters. Not only do you connect with her main characters. But her aide characters are always wonderful!‐

“Emma, you want to hold one?” Mom asked.
She gasped. “Yes!”
A hand emerged from the back seat with a tiny chittering raccoon in it wrapped in a bar towel.
“This is George Cooney.”
Emma took it and held it to her chest and looked at me with hearts in her eyes. “Look at his little hands!”

-There are just so many beautiful parts of this book! But one of my favorite qoutes were....

“Unhealed trauma is a crack. And all the little hard things that trickle into it that would have rolled off someone else, settle. Then when life gets cold, that crack gets bigger, longer, deeper. It makes new breaks. You don’t know how broken she was or what she was trying to do to fill those cracks. Being broken is not an excuse for bad behavior, you still have to make good choices and do the right thing. But it can be the reason. And sometimes understanding the reason can be what helps you heal.”

"The best kind of love doesn’t happen on moonlit walks and romantic vacations. It happens in between the folds of everyday life. It’s not grand gestures that show how you feel, it’s all the little secret things you do to make her life better that you never tell her about."

-I usually am dreading Abby's 3rd act breakups! But this time I loved it. The growth that came from it was so needed and the book wouldn't have been the same without it.
Was it heartbreaking to read? 1000%
But this time it was as beautiful as it was heartbreaking!-

-AND I CANT FORGET THE EASTER EGGS!! I have to admit I didn't see any of those twists coming. But to see that come full circle was pretty cool!

I also listened to the audio after reading the book and it was an incredible performance by Chrstine Lakin and Zachary Webber!! They were the perfect voices for these two characters!
date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on 6 April 2024
profile.name: Shana

title: An easy 5 star read and will be one of my top favorite reads of 2024!
body: Absolutely loved loved loved! I devoured this book, and although I kept trying to pace myself so it would last longer, I ended up finishing it in less than 24 hours, because I just couldn't put it down! An easy 5 star read for me and I have no doubt it'll be one of my top favorite books of 2024!  I was excited about this book's release thinking that I would like it, but I was not expecting to love it as much as I did! My favorite Abby Jimenez book by far! It was absolute perfection. I mean we have a gardening loving, travel nurse as our female main character then we throw in a dash of magical realism?! Are you kidding me? If that book isn't meant for me than I don't know what is! 😂  One of my major conditions on how much I love a rom-com is how it makes me feel while reading it. If the book is giving me butterflies, heart-dropping angst, and making me kick my legs because I am so giddy, then it's 5 star perfection and this, my friends, gave me all of this and more.  The characters were absolutely perfect. As I mentioned earlier, Emma was a FMC of my dreams, but then we get the MMC, Justin, who was just as perfect. From page one, I was hooked and was pleasantly surprised to see what this storyline was all about. Both characters believe their love lives to be cursed. After dating someone and breaking up with them that person always meets the love of their life right after. Discovering one another through a Reddit thread and both sharing the same dilemma, Emma and Justin decide to date for a short period of time to cancel out each other's curse. And well, we all know where this is going. 😉  Another thing I loved and what I really appreciated the author gave us is a believable third act conflict. We all know when picking up a romance, we are getting one. Unfortunately, sometimes they can really mess the flow up for me while reading, because at times they don't feel natural, or they are just plain silly like the dreaded miscommunication trope, which is guaranteed to make my eyes roll. I was so pleasantly surprised we didn't get one of those and instead got a great segue into how the book concludes. 🙌  This is a standalone novel in case anyone was wondering. Abby gives us lots of Easter eggs and it was fun to read her thought process at the end of why she included what. But luckily you don't have to read any of her previous books to enjoy this one and in my opinion, they weren't too spoiler-y.  Overall, and I can't stress this enough I loved it and can't recommend it enough. I feel it would be a slam dunk winner for anyone who decides to pick it up!
body_html:
Absolutely loved loved loved! I devoured this book, and although I kept trying to pace myself so it would last longer, I ended up finishing it in less than 24 hours, because I just couldn't put it down! An easy 5 star read for me and I have no doubt it'll be one of my top favorite books of 2024!

I was excited about this book's release thinking that I would like it, but I was not expecting to love it as much as I did! My favorite Abby Jimenez book by far! It was absolute perfection. I mean we have a gardening loving, travel nurse as our female main character then we throw in a dash of magical realism?! Are you kidding me? If that book isn't meant for me than I don't know what is! 😂

One of my major conditions on how much I love a rom-com is how it makes me feel while reading it. If the book is giving me butterflies, heart-dropping angst, and making me kick my legs because I am so giddy, then it's 5 star perfection and this, my friends, gave me all of this and more.

The characters were absolutely perfect. As I mentioned earlier, Emma was a FMC of my dreams, but then we get the MMC, Justin, who was just as perfect. From page one, I was hooked and was pleasantly surprised to see what this storyline was all about. Both characters believe their love lives to be cursed. After dating someone and breaking up with them that person always meets the love of their life right after. Discovering one another through a Reddit thread and both sharing the same dilemma, Emma and Justin decide to date for a short period of time to cancel out each other's curse. And well, we all know where this is going. 😉

Another thing I loved and what I really appreciated the author gave us is a believable third act conflict. We all know when picking up a romance, we are getting one. Unfortunately, sometimes they can really mess the flow up for me while reading, because at times they don't feel natural, or they are just plain silly like the dreaded miscommunication trope, which is guaranteed to make my eyes roll. I was so pleasantly surprised we didn't get one of those and instead got a great segue into how the book concludes. 🙌

This is a standalone novel in case anyone was wondering. Abby gives us lots of Easter eggs and it was fun to read her thought process at the end of why she included what. But luckily you don't have to read any of her previous books to enjoy this one and in my opinion, they weren't too spoiler-y.

Overall, and I can't stress this enough I loved it and can't recommend it enough. I feel it would be a slam dunk winner for anyone who decides to pick it up!

profile.name: Celene

title: Rating: 4.25 Stars
body: “The best kind of love doesn't happen on moonlit walks and romantic vacations. It happens in between the folds of everyday life.”  “In a world where you can choose anger or empathy, always choose empathy.”  Read if you Enjoy: * Lake Vibes * He Falls First * Forced Proximity * Online meet-cute * Found family * Dual POV * Mental Health Awareness/ Trauma  Rating:  “You’re not asking too much,” he said. “You were just asking the wrong person. Ask me instead.”  Abby has done it again! This book was everything I expected and more.  First of all, even though this book can be read as a standalone, I would highly recommend reading Part of Your World and Yours Truly first to understand some of the events/characters that take place in this one. Specifically Part of Your World as the big shocker in the end is connected.  Now on to this review! Justin and Emma meet online through a Reddit post as both characters connect over their unfortunate bad luck in love. You see… every time they date someone and they break up, the exes move on to find the love of their lives. Through a mutual pact, they both agree to date each other and “break” their curse. The rules… four dates, one kiss, and a breakup. Not complicated at all, right?  I loved this book! The amount of meaningful quotes and laugh-out-loud moments had me eating the pages. Justin has become a favorite MMC! His ideas for the dates, his surveys, his special moments with Emma, and his love for his family were admirable. This book also handles trauma, a toxic parent, and new guardianship. Abby did a great job navigating the not-so-happy moments on the page as well. Loved Maddie and her unwavering support for Emma.  “You can love someone and still not be willing to give up your way of life for them. And then there are those you love who you’d take a bullet for. It’s all the same emotion, just different levels.”  If you are looking for your next book, pick up Abby. She is an auto-buy author and I can’t wait to read more!
body_html:
“The best kind of love doesn't happen on moonlit walks and romantic vacations. It happens in between the folds of everyday life.”

“In a world where you can choose anger or empathy, always choose empathy.”

Read if you Enjoy:
* Lake Vibes
* He Falls First
* Forced Proximity
* Online meet-cute
* Found family
* Dual POV
* Mental Health Awareness/ Trauma

Rating:

“You’re not asking too much,” he said. “You were just asking the wrong person. Ask me instead.”

Abby has done it again! This book was everything I expected and more.

First of all, even though this book can be read as a standalone, I would highly recommend reading Part of Your World and Yours Truly first to understand some of the events/characters that take place in this one. Specifically Part of Your World as the big shocker in the end is connected.

Now on to this review! Justin and Emma meet online through a Reddit post as both characters connect over their unfortunate bad luck in love. You see… every time they date someone and they break up, the exes move on to find the love of their lives. Through a mutual pact, they both agree to date each other and “break” their curse. The rules… four dates, one kiss, and a breakup. Not complicated at all, right?

I loved this book! The amount of meaningful quotes and laugh-out-loud moments had me eating the pages. Justin has become a favorite MMC! His ideas for the dates, his surveys, his special moments with Emma, and his love for his family were admirable. This book also handles trauma, a toxic parent, and new guardianship. Abby did a great job navigating the not-so-happy moments on the page as well. Loved Maddie and her unwavering support for Emma.

“You can love someone and still not be willing to give up your way of life for them. And then there are those you love who you’d take a bullet for. It’s all the same emotion, just different levels.”

If you are looking for your next book, pick up Abby. She is an auto-buy author and I can’t wait to read more!
date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on 6 June 2024
profile.name: Yani

title: Hunger Games meets Royalty
body: Love love loved this book, the novella that recently came out I couldn't get into but I cannot wait for more of the main story.  I loved the world building, the story line, it had me in tears at the end. My heart shattered by decisions made, but the second book release is creeping up and I cannot wait to pick it up.  The story follow Paedyn, she lives in the slums, she's bottom of the food chain. She's what they called an "Ordinary" but no one knows this, because if they did it would cost her life. An Ordinary is someone who doesn't have powers, instead she has taught herself, well her father at first taught her, to be extremely observant and she pretends to be a physic. Which she successfully fools everyone.  Now bring in the storyline, Paedyn is a thief, and thiefs steal. She so happens to steal from the younger prince, the future enforcer. But later in the day she sees that the prince is struggling to fight against a really powerful person who has the ability to almost overwhelm someone by stripping them of their power. Now since Paedyn doesn't have powers, she's able to save the prince. But instead, she lands herself as a contestant for the Purging Trials. Which kind of reminds me of Hunger games.  Through these trials she gets to know the prince she saved, but also the other prince as well, the future king. Now that is all I am about to say about the story because you've just got to read it to experience it. Its enticing, its a little slow to begin with but I legitimately could not put the book down for the second half.
body_html:

profile.name: M3lzii6

title: 3.5 actually- fine, until it got frustrating
body: The media could not be loaded. So I actually liked this book, the plot was good, I liked the magic element as an addition, the trials were interesting enough to keep the page turning and I genuinely enjoyed allthe characters, there was a good spread. Kai is the perfect book boyfriend, all taunt and sweet talk - loved the banter between the main characters, all though the dagger to the throat got a bit tedious, but all in good jest I get it. So I was merrily enjoying my way through this book until about eighty percent from which I personally just couldn't get on board. I am all for, I mean ALL for a slow burn, but a personal ick of mine is when the characters never act on it. For the whole book to play out without a single kiss being achieved, with how gorgeous Kai was, how close they were and the tension of impending death, I just … I don't know, for me it just kinda dragged, unfortunately the plot after that couldn't push past my frustrations. I'm still interested to see what comes next … the book was good, sometimes we just get lost in our own expectations.

title: if tension and slow burn was a book… it would be this 🥵
body: Really enjoyed this read start to finish! The tension between Kai and Pae was 🥵🤤. The only reason this read is not a 5 star is because the storyline and world building was too familiar to previous, more popular series. Otherwise, I CAN NOT wait for the next book.

profile.name: Bella Messina

title: What a wild ride.
body: This book has a Hunger Ganes feel to it at times with the trials. Even the love triangle seems similar, and the two princes both vying for Paedyns attention. The powerful abilities of the contestants and Blair, the typical mean girl, and her interaction with everyone was fun to read. I liked Jax and Andy. Their characters were well developed and relatable. The King, as the evil one ruling his kingdom with an iron fist, was someone who deserved his reputation. Kai was a complex character, and his struggle for redemption was interesting to watch despite who he had become. Kitt was my least favourite, his rose coloured glasses, and constantly searching for his father's aporoval made him seem weak and more of a puppet than a king to be. Pae was the most interesting, ordinary but strong, loving despite the cruelty of the hand that fate dealt her. She was driven to seek revenge, and in the end, she got more than she bargained for. I can't wait for the book as this one was a page-turner with its twists and revelations.

profile.name: Kindle Customer

title: Good start
body: I enjoyed this book but it was rather slow and there was not really any romance. This book was a mix of the hunger games with the trials, divergent with different powers/strengths and then a bit of a love triangle between two brothers but nothing happened. I’m hoping this was just setting it up for the second book to be more fast paced. Was still defiently an enjoyable read.

profile.name: Mikayla

title: Plagiarism At Its Best!
body: I really loved this story. Oh wait I’ve read it before!! The Hunger Games - from coloured hair, big glass bowls for votes, gifts for players, stupid, manufactured trials to supposedly control the masses, evil controllers, ridiculous balls, elites and nobodies, a love triangle, to the designer being slain and then finally to Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire with moving hedges. Does this author have an original idea she’d like to put on paper? I somehow doubt it. Just gobsmacking that she has even been published in my opinion.

title: Must read! This book was amazing!
body: I devoured this book! I was absolutely captivated from start to finish. I could not put it down.  From the plot to the characters, it was all beautifully written. It constantly kept you guessing. The chemistry between the two main characters was palpable.  If you're on the fence about whether or not to read this book, do yourself a favour and just buy it. You won't be disappointed!  The only downside is having to wait for the sequel!

profile.name: AmbzyRoseBooks

title: Sooooo good!!
body: I am unwell. The ending of this book, it hurt. A lot. GOD DAMN!!?!  I had high hopes for this book and boy did it deliver! As always, I love a book with duel POVs.  It was a hunger games style story with magic. People have a particular magic (super strength, mind reading, shifting etc) and are called the Elites. Then the Ordinarys which are well ordinary people without magic.  The characters seeped into my soul, the plot was intriguing and exciting and the slow-burn be burnnnnnnnning. I'm going to think about these characters in the days to come 😅 be warned - all that tension and angst and not even a kiss.  Some people say it starts a bit slow, but it had me from the start. By chapter 10 I knew I wasn't going to be able to put it down. Some parts were predictable and I saw coming from a mile away and others were a shock to me! Very excited to read Reckless when it comes out!!

title: Torn Review
body: Just finished “Powerless” and I’m torn! While I enjoyed the diverse perspectives and especially connected with Kai’s character (reminded me of my boyfriend!), I found myself wanting more action at times. Plus, fair warning: there are a lot of feelings involved, so if you’re not into that, maybe give this one a pass.

profile.name: Kindle Customer

title: Powerless - Review
body: Believe the hype. I had this one on my TBR but was worried it had been over hyped (like most of booktoks recs) so it stayed there for a while. It’s a simple yet interesting world, easy to follow. You’re straight into it from the first sentence. The TENSION, the way both characters navigate their own storyline but are so heavily intertwined at the same time, the banter between the two, the chemistry. Strong female lead full of wit and power, strong male lead but one who isn’t afraid to divulge feelings, family dilemmas, angst, wholesome friendships, betrayal, huge enemies to lovers vibes!

profile.name: melsbookspace

title: Captivating low fantasy to go feral for
body: That ending had me sobbing. It hurt. A lot.  I have decided after reading this book that I will be absolutely feral for it. The world and characters aren't just created but brought to life. Both Paedyn and Kai are strong and loveable.  I'll be honest, it wasn't perfect, there were editorial mistakes and unnecessary repetition but it's still a 5 to me because I managed to feel all the feels and devour it and everything happening.  While the start is slightly slower I appreciate that as it gives the reader a chance to get to know the world, magic systems and characters a bit before anything too crazy happens (and it does get crazy).  I loved that Lauren didn't try to make Kai or Pae perfect and that made them feel so much more real. They felt like people just trying to survive what their lives threw at them in the only way they'd been raised to know.  Kai is my latest book boyfriend and will probably be hard to beat in future. He radiates power and charisma and it's no wonder he made Paes heart hurt. The way that from the very beginning he has eyes only for her and will do whatever it takes to keep her alive.. The way he doesn't even have to try to learn things about her, he just naturally does because he cares.  Pae is everybit scared as she is strong. She is full of wit, charisma, stubbornness and fierceness. She knows exactly how to be a psychic and how much power she holds. Her confidence is admirable. And the way she tries to stay away from Kai because she doesn't want to hurt him but can't is both and and amazing.  To me the slow Burn romance is what makes it even more amazing. It fits the characters perfectly and to me there is no need for more at this point. It paints the picture of their chemistry and shows exactly who they are deep down.  Also Kitt our future King. There's no way I could forget him. There is a depth to his character that I don't often see in side characters. Where his character finishes at the end of the book could be seen coming but it still doesn't hurt any less.  Overall I am obsessed and will be reading the next books asap. I also will be booking in my next tattoo shortly (lemon meringue and butterscotch) I don't even care if it becomes a tamlin tattoo 😅
body_html:
That ending had me sobbing. It hurt. A lot.

I have decided after reading this book that I will be absolutely feral for it. The world and characters aren't just created but brought to life. Both Paedyn and Kai are strong and loveable.

I'll be honest, it wasn't perfect, there were editorial mistakes and unnecessary repetition but it's still a 5 to me because I managed to feel all the feels and devour it and everything happening.

While the start is slightly slower I appreciate that as it gives the reader a chance to get to know the world, magic systems and characters a bit before anything too crazy happens (and it does get crazy).

I loved that Lauren didn't try to make Kai or Pae perfect and that made them feel so much more real. They felt like people just trying to survive what their lives threw at them in the only way they'd been raised to know.

Kai is my latest book boyfriend and will probably be hard to beat in future. He radiates power and charisma and it's no wonder he made Paes heart hurt. The way that from the very beginning he has eyes only for her and will do whatever it takes to keep her alive.. The way he doesn't even have to try to learn things about her, he just naturally does because he cares.

Pae is everybit scared as she is strong. She is full of wit, charisma, stubbornness and fierceness. She knows exactly how to be a psychic and how much power she holds. Her confidence is admirable. And the way she tries to stay away from Kai because she doesn't want to hurt him but can't is both and and amazing.

To me the slow Burn romance is what makes it even more amazing. It fits the characters perfectly and to me there is no need for more at this point. It paints the picture of their chemistry and shows exactly who they are deep down.

Also Kitt our future King. There's no way I could forget him. There is a depth to his character that I don't often see in side characters. Where his character finishes at the end of the book could be seen coming but it still doesn't hurt any less.

Overall I am obsessed and will be reading the next books asap.
I also will be booking in my next tattoo shortly (lemon meringue and butterscotch) I don't even care if it becomes a tamlin tattoo 😅

profile.name: Client d'Amazon

title: Slow start but RIVETING by the end
body: OMG! My heart is… I don’t know what it is! This book builds you up then tears you down. It has magic, power, love, compassion, fighting, bickering, teasing, trust, betrayal and so much more! The world building is fantastic. The character development is great. I was drawn in from the start even though it started slow - initially gave me Hunger Games vibes but it has its own twist (besides the magic abilities). I can’t wait to read the next book to see what happens with Paedyn, Kai and Kitt. I definitely recommend this book!!!!

date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on 16 May 2024
profile.name: lhall.books247

title: I AM OBSESSED
body: Powerless... I am obsessed. I have not stopped thinking about this book since I finished it.  Let start with Paeydn. My favorite FMC are secretive, strong and ambitious. She checks all of my boxes. She is in the minority, being a "Ordinary" a.k.a a powerless mundane in a world where they are hunted and killed. She was raised in a way to read other and trick them into believing she is a psychic. She is observant and knows exactly how to get the reaction that she wants from someone.  "Make them underestimate you. Make them overlook you until you want to be seen."  KAI freaking AZER..... This man... GOOOOOD LORD the things this man says had me BLUSHING! He is one of my new favorite book boyfriends. He has the power to sense and take on the powers of others, yet even he is fooled by Paeydns amazing talent and logical reasoning.  “Will you forever be the prize I am aimlessly trying to win" "Is that all I am to you? A trophy?" "Oh, darling, a trophy implies that I won it, earned it, deserve it." He leans in farther, a certain reverence in his gaze. "But if i get to have you, it will be because you let me.”  THE TENSION! Lauren.... Does she know how to write build up and tension!  “Mark my words, Prince, I will be your undoing.” I lean in, ignoring the knife against my throat as I murmur, “Oh, darling, I look forward to it.”  Overall I loved this book when I finished it and I am still obsessed with it a month later! I cannot wait to read Reckless and Powerful!
body_html:
Powerless...
I am obsessed. I have not stopped thinking about this book since I finished it.

Let start with Paeydn. My favorite FMC are secretive, strong and ambitious. She checks all of my boxes. She is in the minority, being a "Ordinary" a.k.a a powerless mundane in a world where they are hunted and killed. She was raised in a way to read other and trick them into believing she is a psychic. She is observant and knows exactly how to get the reaction that she wants from someone.

"Make them underestimate you. Make them overlook you until you want to be seen."

KAI freaking AZER..... This man... GOOOOOD LORD the things this man says had me BLUSHING! He is one of my new favorite book boyfriends. He has the power to sense and take on the powers of others, yet even he is fooled by Paeydns amazing talent and logical reasoning.

“Will you forever be the prize I am aimlessly trying to win"
"Is that all I am to you? A trophy?"
"Oh, darling, a trophy implies that I won it, earned it, deserve it." He leans in farther, a certain reverence in his gaze. "But if i get to have you, it will be because you let me.”

THE TENSION! Lauren.... Does she know how to write build up and tension!

“Mark my words, Prince, I will be your undoing.” I lean in, ignoring the knife against my throat as I murmur, “Oh, darling, I look forward to it.”

Overall I loved this book when I finished it and I am still obsessed with it a month later! I cannot wait to read Reckless and Powerful!

profile.name: Lauraaa

title: Blog Once Upon a Time a Book
body: Nel mondo di Paedyn Gray coloro che non hanno poteri alla nascita, i cosiddetti Ordinari, non possono vivere. Vengono letteralmente uccisi. E tutti coloro che cercheranno di nasconderli avranno la stessa fine. Chi si occuperà di questo? Kai. Kai è un Elite figlio del re, colui che ha uno dei più importanti poteri, capire se le persone hanno o meno un potere ed incanalarlo per utilizzarlo a sua volta. Il destino a volte è davvero bizzarro, perché a causa di varie vicissitudini Paedyn si ritroverà a salvare il caro principe dal Silenziatore. Ovvero coloro che hanno il potere di annullare tutti gli altri poteri. Ma questo salvataggio sarà anche la sua rovina, perché da lì a poco si ritroverà iscritta al torneo, dove ci sarà un solo vincitore. E dove la morte può trovarti in ogni prova. Inutile dirvi che fin dal primo incontro tra i due succederà qualcosa che li porterà ad essere sempre più attratti gli uni dagli altri. Ma entrambi hanno dei segreti che li allontanerà sempre più fino a diventare dei veri e propri nemici. Quello che però si ritroveranno a vivere, non dipende da loro, ma da un passato che li segnerà per sempre, dove intrighi, ribelli, soppressioni, torture, allenamenti, dolori, solitudini e soprattutto mancanza di amore, faranno da sfondo. Ho davvero adorato questo romanzo, non quanto per le scene che mi hanno tenuta con il fiato sospeso, quando per i protagonisti, che ad ogni incontrano si ritrovano a scoprire e a donarsi. Donare e condividere tutto. Nel bene e nel male. Portandoli sempre più a dipendere gli uni dall’altri. Kai è meraviglioso, dolce e spietato, bellissimo e nello stesso tempo timido, amorevole verso tutti coloro che ama. Paedyn dall’altra parte cercherà di sopravvivere e di ottenere quella vendetta che l’ha privata di tutto. Io ve lo stra consiglio, tra l’altro uscirà a breve in Italia grazie alla Newton Compton Editori, quindi forza! Andate ad effettuare il preordine!

title: Now THIS is how you write tension!!
body: Now THIS is how you write tension!! Hats off to Lauren Roberts for physically having me on the edge of my seat while reading this book. This is an absolutely astounding debut novel, I found myself completely immersed, devouring it in practically one sitting because it was just that addicting!  I felt very Hunger Games meets The Serpent and the Wings of Night vibes from the beginning, but don't be fooled, this is a masterpiece all in it's own!!  This is a book is truly designed for those who crave a true romantic fantasy, it encompasses every element that I love with a few more that I didn't even realize I needed! As a devout fan of the forbidden love trope, this one hit all the right notes. Paedyn and Kai were utterly captivating, I couldn't get enough of their interactions. The tension and banter were not only fulfilling but also entertaining! There is the perfect combination of action, tension, romance and intrigue to keep the reader hooked the entire way through.  Paedyn, as the leading female character, was a force to be reckoned with. Her storyline will have you on her side from the very beginning, she is courageous, tenacious and has a heart of gold! She embodied a refreshing and fun character, and I can't wait to see the twists and turns that this series has in store for her. Kai is intriguing and incredibly charming, his interactions with Pae allowed the reader to feel their palpable chemistry. His own intriguing backstory only adds to the excitement, and I'm eagerly anticipating more of his character's development. We also get to meet a host of side characters, some who I really hope are a larger part of the next part in this series!  This book is a must-read for anyone enamored with romantasy! It seamlessly weaves together all of the essential elements while still feeling fresh and unique in it’s own way!

title: wow , wow , wow!!
body: WOWW , THE TENSION , THE RAGE , THE CLIFFHANGER??!! 💔  plot line: Only the extraordinary belong in the kingdom of Ilya . . . The exceptional. The Elites. The Elites have possessed powers for decades, gifted to them by the Plague, while those born Ordinary are just that, banished from the kingdom and shunned from society.  No one knows this better than Paedyn Gray, an Ordinary posing as an Elite. When she unsuspectingly saves one of Ilya’s princes, Kai Azer, she’s thrown into the Purging Trials, a brutal competition to showcase her ‘Elite’ powers.  If the Trials and the opponents don’t kill her, the prince she’s fighting feelings for will if he discovers what Paedyn really is . . . completely Ordinary.  my thoughts: I am utterly speechless… 🤯 from start to finish this book had me on a roller coaster of emotions , BELIEVE ME when I say that this book has more twists and turns than a snake.  although this has no relevance to the plot i feel as though I should mention that as a reader I have struggled to read fantasy books in the past due to having so much information and terminology thrown at me (that I don’t understand) that in the end I have either lost interest or just put down the book.  so I was VERY happy that it wasn’t the case when it came to this book.  *if you have struggled to read fantasy books in the past (like me) please give this one a go and if it’s your style , listen to the audiobook not only because it’s more understandable but Kai’s voice is 🔥🔥🔥*  the chokehold Kai had over me whilst reading this book was unbelievable  speaking of the characters , they each had their own role that played a part in the whole of the plot. I especially loved Paedyn’s fierce and powerful personality as I think from a female perspective it shows courage to not give up , plus we love a bad b**ch over here 🫶🏼  whilst I LOVED the whole book and can’t fault the way it made me feel , as a reader who finds it hard to concentrate and zones out (a lot) this book was quite long and if I’m being honest I think it could’ve been shortened.  I should also mention that whilst I’m not sure if Lauren was taking some inspiration from other books / authors - there were many similarities to the following movies; hunger games , maze runner & divergent.  overall , I LOVED everything about this book and can’t wait to read book two later in the year 🥰
body_html:
WOWW , THE TENSION , THE RAGE , THE CLIFFHANGER??!! 💔

plot line:
Only the extraordinary belong in the kingdom of Ilya . . . The exceptional. The Elites. The Elites have possessed powers for decades, gifted to them by the Plague, while those born Ordinary are just that, banished from the kingdom and shunned from society.

No one knows this better than Paedyn Gray, an Ordinary posing as an Elite. When she unsuspectingly saves one of Ilya’s princes, Kai Azer, she’s thrown into the Purging Trials, a brutal competition to showcase her ‘Elite’ powers.

If the Trials and the opponents don’t kill her, the prince she’s fighting feelings for will if he discovers what Paedyn really is . . . completely Ordinary.

my thoughts:
I am utterly speechless… 🤯
from start to finish this book had me on a roller coaster of emotions , BELIEVE ME when I say that this book has more twists and turns than a snake.

although this has no relevance to the plot i feel as though I should mention that as a reader I have struggled to read fantasy books in the past due to having so much information and terminology thrown at me (that I don’t understand) that in the end I have either lost interest or just put down the book.

so I was VERY happy that it wasn’t the case when it came to this book.

*if you have struggled to read fantasy books in the past (like me) please give this one a go and if it’s your style , listen to the audiobook not only because it’s more understandable but Kai’s voice is 🔥🔥🔥*

the chokehold Kai had over me whilst reading this book was unbelievable

speaking of the characters , they each had their own role that played a part in the whole of the plot. I especially loved Paedyn’s fierce and powerful personality as I think from a female perspective it shows courage to not give up , plus we love a bad b**ch over here 🫶🏼

whilst I LOVED the whole book and can’t fault the way it made me feel , as a reader who finds it hard to concentrate and zones out (a lot) this book was quite long and if I’m being honest I think it could’ve been shortened.

I should also mention that whilst I’m not sure if Lauren was taking some inspiration from other books / authors - there were many similarities to the following movies; hunger games , maze runner & divergent.

overall , I LOVED everything about this book and can’t wait to read book two later in the year 🥰

title: THIS book is the best!!!
body: This book is one i cannot stop recommending for literally anyone!! It had me on my toes, wondering what was gonna happen next.  The story is set in the kingdom of Ilya, which is divided between the Elites, who possess powers, and the Ordinaries, who do not. The Ordinaries are hunted down and killed due to the belief that they spread disease among the Elites. The protagonist, Paedyn Gray, is an Ordinary who pretends to be a psychic to survive in the slums. However, when she saves the life of one of the king's sons, Kai, she is thrown into the Purging Trials, a competition that showcases the powers of the Elites. Paedyn must do whatever it takes to hide her secret and survive, all while battling her growing feelings for the prince.  Paedyn’s personality is one i admire, she is resourceful and skilled, using her skills to get through all the trials whilst being an “Ordinary.” She’s determined, risking her life to fight for her place. It broke my heart reading what she went through, but knowing she’s a strong soul that won’t ever stop fighting it relieved me to see her push her way through everything.  Kai Azer first got saved by Paedyn, as he becomes her love interest. They go from enemies to potential lovers, along with SO much tension! He has a great sense of humour, but most of what people see from the outside is just a mere mask. He has his own struggles, one of the biggest being meeting his father’s expectations. Everything he went through was heartbreaking, knowing he got so strong by what his father has done to him.  When i was done reading this book i was on the verge of tears, since the last 20 pages completely broke me apart. This book has so many plot-twists, and it is so well-written. Everything the characters have done had reasonings, and i’m excited for the second book to come out. 🥹🤍

title: Fantastic book for young athletes
body: Highly recommend this book. After a tough summer with a bad coach (not a tough coach, that is different) I have been struggling to help my 11 yr old son get through a mental wall and rebuild confidence. Resources are limited at this age. I stumbled across this book and thankful I did. We are only 2.5 chapters in and I can see him thinking about what we are reading and trying to apply what he is learning. His coach, who doesn’t even know what we are doing, came up and commented on how much harder he worked at practice this week, and the change in his focus. He also did his first speech for school recently, and I showed him how to use these techniques on overcoming the anxiety around this as well. These are great tools for them to learn to have forever. Even I am noticing that I am using the tools now in my day to day, especially with an over coming anxious moments. There is something for all of us in this book.

profile.name: ATsMama

title: Basketball Team Summer Book Club Top Pick!
body: If you are an athlete you know you’d rather be playing your sport than reading. But I had my son read this book to see if we should read it for his basketball team’s book club. And it was an instant winner, even beating out Kobe’s Mamba Mentality. Below is a summary of strengths and a recommendation from my 5th grader.  From the introduction, this book captures the young reader’s attention and it just continues to flow. The use of bold lettering, bullet points, and spacing makes this an easier read to stick with than a lot of other books. You can pause in between chapters and feel confident picking the book back up. I love the chapter summaries, quotes, and stories about successful athletes and their families. The authors clearly paint the picture that mental toughness is as, if not more important, than athletic ability.  If this book is ever revised, consider ending the chapter with the exercise on it’s own page (after the summary and book recommendation) or end the book with all exercises combined. That way it’s easier to find and repeat each exercise daily in between readings. -

title: Little Girls Can be Tough Too!
body: So, my daughter decides to take up Football (Soccer) having had no interest until nearly 8 years old, when suddenly the bug takes hold following a school trial session and a suggestion from a friend to give it a go.  Fast forward nearly three years and she has made fantastic progress in a very short time with a recent invite for an academy trial with the biggest local team!  Now the road to this point has been bumpy and props to my daughter for showing the courage to continue despite them but, one thing that did significantly help her (and myself as ‘Dad coach’), was this little gem of a book I stumbled upon whilst considering how to help her become more focused and able to understand that sport comes with it’s bumps and bruises and it’s ok to be competitive and ‘give it back’ as it were (within the rules) as sport is a different thing than our day to day manner, something I noticed many similar age struggle with.  We read through the book together one chapter at a time and then I would sit back and let the ideas marinate only to stand back in awe to see her apply the very ideas and have a new level of determination show through in the very next game! So much so, her coaches were taken aback too and it made for a new central position in the team with her new found battling instinct to pair with her already formidable athleticism and rapidly improving skills and tactical understanding.  Regardless of the sport your little one has chosen, the path will have many similarities given it’s ‘the mind the drives the thing’, so consider purchasing this very reasonably priced and highly accessible little book for them to read and watch how it influences them to show their best selves too!
body_html:
So, my daughter decides to take up Football (Soccer) having had no interest until nearly 8 years old, when suddenly the bug takes hold following a school trial session and a suggestion from a friend to give it a go.

Fast forward nearly three years and she has made fantastic progress in a very short time with a recent invite for an academy trial with the biggest local team!

Now the road to this point has been bumpy and props to my daughter for showing the courage to continue despite them but, one thing that did significantly help her (and myself as ‘Dad coach’), was this little gem of a book I stumbled upon whilst considering how to help her become more focused and able to understand that sport comes with it’s bumps and bruises and it’s ok to be competitive and ‘give it back’ as it were (within the rules) as sport is a different thing than our day to day manner, something I noticed many similar age struggle with.

We read through the book together one chapter at a time and then I would sit back and let the ideas marinate only to stand back in awe to see her apply the very ideas and have a new level of determination show through in the very next game! So much so, her coaches were taken aback too and it made for a new central position in the team with her new found battling instinct to pair with her already formidable athleticism and rapidly improving skills and tactical understanding.

Regardless of the sport your little one has chosen, the path will have many similarities given it’s ‘the mind the drives the thing’, so consider purchasing this very reasonably priced and highly accessible little book for them to read and watch how it influences them to show their best selves too!

title: Mental Toughness For Young Athletes: A Helpful Resource with Some Flaws
body: Overall, I thought Mental Toughness For Young Athletes was an okay book. The principles are sound and the exercises are easy to follow. However, I found the book to be a bit too American-centric. The author uses a lot of American sports examples, which can be a bit alienating for readers from other countries. Additionally, the editing in the book is poor. There are a number of typos and grammatical errors, which can make it difficult to read at times.  Despite these flaws, I think Mental Toughness For Young Athletes could be a helpful resource for young athletes who are looking to improve their mental toughness. The principles are sound and the exercises are easy to follow. If you can overlook the American-centric focus and the poor editing, I think this book will be a helpful resource.  Here are some of the pros and cons of the book:  Pros:  The principles are sound. The exercises are easy to follow. My daughter liked it, and we read it aloud together.  Cons:  The book is a bit too American-centric. The editing is poor. Sometimes it's hard to follow.  Overall, I would give this book a 4 out of 5 stars. It's not a perfect book, but it could be a helpful resource for young athletes who are looking to improve their mental toughness.
